review_content:
gefunden im Billa-Supermarkt am Hauptbahnhof Prag, wo ich mich gefreut hatte ein neues tschechisches Bier zu finden. Es stellte sich dann als amerkanisches Witbier nach belgischen Vorbild heraus -das noch dazu von einer aufegekauften Brauerei des Giganten Molson-Coors kommt.
Ein trübes Witbier, das ein MHD von über einem Jahr nach Kauf hat, ist schon versächtig.
Bei Einscheinken verströmt es schon einen intensiven Duft nach Orangenzeste, den man auch im Geschmackskörper widerfindet. Allerdings ist dieses Aroma aber verdammt chemisch-falsch.
Sonst kommt ein hefig-getreidiges Aroma durch, aber auch nicht besonders natürlich oder urig wirkt.
Es mag intensive Witbiernoten - besonders Orange und Orangenzeste - haben, aber einfach zu chemisch sein.
Gulbrun farge med hvitt skum. Lukter hvete, banan. Noe tam i munnfølelse. Søtlig smak.
Light base wheat beer with some wit beer like flavors but very subdued. No real coriander like taste, just maybe a bit of the citrus orange peel.  Reasonable beer for a mass made Belgian wit.

Amarela,turva,espuma cremosa com boa formação e média duração,aroma com leve cítrico e frutado, sabor segue o aroma,bem leve e refrescante,baixo corpo,carbonatação média/baixa,drinkability razoável.
Wit leve demais,cítrico com pouca intensidade e condimentos (coentro) nem aparece, não merece toda fama.

Pomarańczowe, zmętnione z obfitą drobnopęcherzykową białą pianą. Aromat słodowy na pszeniczny sposób, cytrusowy i lekko drożdżowy. W smaku słodowe, słodkie, lekko kwaskowe z nutami pomarańczy. Goryczki prawie brak, wysycenie na średnim poziomie. Dobrze pijalne.
Cerveja de trigo, tipo white belgian. Refrescante, levemente cítrica. Bom equilíbrio entre acidez e dulçor.
Odore buonissimo e agrumato, sapore lievitoso perché è una birra belga, anche corposa ma troppo dolce

Kolor pomarańczowy, opalizujący. Piana biała, niska i kompletnie nietrwała. Brak zdobień. 
W aromacie wyczuwalna pomarańcza skórka), landrynki i delikatne nuty słodowe. Bardzo ubogo.
Smak lekko goryczkowy. Tutaj podobnie jak w aromacie wyraźna skórka pomarańczy, lekko perfumowana. Goryczka
Wysokie nasycenie CO2, szybko powoduje uczucie sytości. Tekstura średnio gładka. Ciało średnie. Posmak krótki, perfumowany.
Tastes very citrusey. It's a good pass time beer but, I've outgrown the pverpowering orange flavor.
Bez szału. Bardzo słodkie, posmak sztucznych aromatów owocowych i chemii. Brak goryczki. Przesadzone wysycenie.
Nice light orange color with fruity aromatics. Decent flavor, especially when served with an orange slice. Weak flavor compared to other Belgium beers

33 cl bottle brewed in Czechia by Pivovary Staropramen. Hazy golden orange colour with a big white head. Sweet aroma with lemons, fruits, orange peel and coriander. Taste is light sweet. Medium bodied. Slightly drying fruity finish with orange zest and sweet fruits. Refreshing, somewhat basic in comparison with the best Belgians.
Color anaranjado, aspecto turbio y espuma blanca. Aroma a cítricos y toques ácidos, servir con una rodaja de naranja. Vaso de trigo

Cloudy amber colour. Big fluffy head.
Aroma is orange, bread, yeast.
Has that bread taste like hefeweizen, but with orange and coriander. Nice refreshing taste. Enjoyable.
Been awhile since I have had one. Nice, refreshing, cloudy,  hint of orange.

gefunden im Billa-Supermarkt am Hauptbahnhof Prag, wo ich mich gefreut hatte ein neues tschechisches Bier zu finden. Es stellte sich dann als amerkanisches Witbier nach belgischen Vorbild heraus -das noch dazu von einer aufegekauften Brauerei des…
Gulbrun farge med hvitt skum. Lukter hvete, banan. Noe tam i munnfølelse. Søtlig smak.
Light base wheat beer with some wit beer like flavors but very subdued. No real coriander like taste, just maybe a bit of the citrus orange peel.  Reasonable beer for a mass made Belgian wit.
Amarela,turva,espuma cremosa com boa formação e média duração,aroma com leve cítrico e frutado, sabor segue o aroma,bem leve e refrescante,baixo corpo,carbonatação média/baixa,drinkability razoável.…

Pomarańczowe, zmętnione z obfitą drobnopęcherzykową białą pianą. Aromat słodowy na pszeniczny sposób, cytrusowy i lekko drożdżowy. W smaku słodowe, słodkie, lekko kwaskowe z nutami pomarańczy. Goryczki prawie brak, wysycenie na średnim…
Cerveja de trigo, tipo white belgian. Refrescante, levemente cítrica. Bom equilíbrio entre acidez e dulçor.
Odore buonissimo e agrumato, sapore lievitoso perché è una birra belga, anche corposa ma troppo dolce
Kolor pomarańczowy, opalizujący. Piana biała, niska i kompletnie nietrwała. Brak zdobień. W aromacie wyczuwalna pomarańcza skórka), landrynki i delikatne nuty słodowe.…
Tastes very citrusey. It's a good pass time beer but, I've outgrown the pverpowering orange flavor.
Bez szału. Bardzo słodkie, posmak sztucznych aromatów owocowych i chemii. Brak goryczki. Przesadzone wysycenie.
Nice light orange color with fruity aromatics. Decent flavor, especially when served with an orange slice. Weak flavor compared to other Belgium beers

33 cl bottle brewed in Czechia by Pivovary Staropramen. Hazy golden orange colour with a big white head. Sweet aroma with lemons, fruits, orange peel and coriander. Taste is light sweet. Medium bodied. Slightly drying fruity finish with orange zest and…
Color anaranjado, aspecto turbio y espuma blanca. Aroma a cítricos y toques ácidos, servir con una rodaja de naranja. Vaso de trigo
Cloudy amber colour. Big fluffy head. Aroma is orange, bread, yeast. Has that bread taste like hefeweizen, but with orange and coriander. Nice refreshing…
Been awhile since I have had one. Nice, refreshing, cloudy,  hint of orange.
Orange peel taste which I do not like would not buy again the orange hints are not even summer vibes. Horrible!  For my taste anyways
Hazy yellow colour with small white head. Taste of wheat and orange. Taste is fresh and dominated by wheat and citrus with a  squeeze of detergent from the coriander.

Aroma of oranges, wheat, malt, coriander
Hazy orange colour with small head
Taste is citrus cleaning solution, coriander, orange peel, wheat and grass
Smooth oily mouthfeel with low carbonation
Decent, but very soapy
Tasted at home with mum and dad

Bière trouble couleur dorée, mousse absente (étonnant pour une bière se avec « Belgian » dans la description) carbo ok. Nez plein de promesse très prononcé sur les agrumes, l’orange. Goût décevant manquant de peps, amertume faible. Très rafraîchissante ce qui la rend idéale pour une aprem au soleil (quasiment une tourtel en moins sucrée)

0.33 bottle from Aroma market. Brewed by Staropramen, Czech Republic.

Pours orangish, bronze muddy color with almost no/very thin head. Beautiful citrus aroma, orange notes. Bitter, juicy, strong orange and citrus notes, without sugar (which is GREAT). Mild carbonation. Nice and refreshing beer. Love the label/logo.

Jako fino pivce, idealno za popiti jedno hladno u nekoj recimo setnjici prirodom.

Poured from 330 ml bottle, hazy yellow. Aroma of white bread, yeast and orange. Taste- Stale citrus, baking yeast and sticky sweetness finish, not enjoyable. Not a good advertisment for wheat beers. Another 330ml drain pour.

Bottle, 33 cl @home. Pours a hazy golden with a frothy white head. Malty and bready aroma. Smooth taste with citrus and coriander which gives a little tartness. Moderate bitterness and a watery aftertaste. Medium carbonation. A decent beer.
Old rating from 2017 - 355ml bottle. Pours orange colour with a white head. Aromas & tastes of orange peel, coriander, citrus, spices & wheat. Moderate body. Sweet fruity finish

Je me suis fait complètement avoir par l'étiquette qui indiquait Belgian White....il n'y a rien de belge dans cette boisson qui n'est pas à proprement parlé bonne, trop sucrée, avec un alcool à 5,4 % aux abonnés absent et qui manque de cette petite acidité nécessaire aux blanches pour leur donner du pep’s. Pas de quoi décrocher la lune en définitive, et d'ailleurs, je ne vois pas trop ce que l'on peut décrocher avec cela, à part un bonnet d'âne! Le visuel est sur un blond orangé trouble, sans mousse. Le nez est sur le médicament, le curaçao, l'écorce d'orange...étrange tout de même. En bouche, ce n'est pas réellement mieux, plat, sans grand intérêt. Peu corpulent et avec encore moins de longueur....Non...cette blanche n'a rien de belge...

Not as wheaty as I would have imagined a wheat beer to be. Smell was fairly unpleasant, the taste was better. Perhaps I’m simply not well-enough versed in wheat beer. Was drinkable, that’s all I can really say. Definitely got used to the taste as it went on. And as i sit here drinking it i am enjoying it more. Wouldn’t have more than one bottle. Interesting but almost soapy in some ways. Am getting a decent bit of citrus and malt. But doesn’t deliver the kick I was hoping for

Cloudy gold with hints of pale copper. Thin to medium head with ow retention. Aroma intensity 4/5. Tomato, thyme and malt aroma with notes of earth and honey. Light bitter with suggestions of sweet. Light body

330ml bottle. Pours a muddy brown, small off white head. Aroma is wheat, perfumed and floral. Taste is orange zest, coriander, wheat, perfume, sweet honey, bitter in the finish. Body is medium with an average carbonation. There are quite a few flavour notes here but they only combine to make it semi-tasty. Still quite decent.
Fresca y refrescante al principio pero floja al final, un poco aguada y con poquito cuerpo. Vale para acompañar algo de queso pero no esperes un sabor llamativo.

Wygląd: prezentuje się naprawdę dobrze, piana bardzo obfita, śnieżnobiała, drobna i trwała, trzyma się praktycznie do końca. Co do samego piwa, to dość ciemne jak na styl, barwa zbożowa, złota wyraźnie zamglone przez co sprawia wrażenie ciemniejszego.

Aromat: przyprawy na pierwszym planie, kolendra, bergamotka, goździk ponadto trochę nut kwiatowych i pomarańczy. Całkiem normalnie jak na WIT'a.

Smak: dość pełne jak na styl, słodowe, z jakimś brzoskwiniowo morelowym posmakiem do tego trochę goryczki na finiszu ziołowo kwiatowej, generalnie w smaku słabiutko.

Amber, cloudy, full white head  that quickly dissipates. Aroma, sweet and floral. To taste, bitter orange, bergamot, honey, coriander. Disappointing in the finish, watery and inconclusive, with a bitter chemical note.

Aromat ładny - drożdże, kolendra, słód, goździki.
W smaku już nie tak fajnie.
Trochę nijakie, mdłe, słodowo-zbożowe. Mało cech witbiera.
Ciało i goryczka niskie, wysycenie wysokie.
Poprawne, nic więcej.
Hmmm. Pretty poor effort by a major brewer to recreate a Belgian beer. Very gassy, slight aroma and taste of oranges. My advice is to give it a wide berth. I prefer the real Belgian beers!
Hazy golden body. Aroma is citrus herbal. Taste is malty herbal.  Aftertaste is nice balanced.

Piana kremowa drobno pęcherzykowata. Opadając zostawia lacing. Barwa pomarańczowa, mętna. W aromacie kolendra i to ostra, lekkie cytrusy. W smaku pomarańcza, kolendra, cytrusy. Pełne, z wytrawnym finiszem

Pours a hazy pineapple juice colour with a medium head. Light in body with little to almost no decernable malt character. Coriander and orange rind are strong on the nose and palate. Very refreshing on a sunny afternoon and would pair well with Mediterranean fare.
Bottle, 33 cl, SB. Truly in Belgian style, but I found the coriander accents to prominent, almost artificial. Went fine with a prawn dish at home, though.
Cerveza color oro viejo opaco, con notas a cáscaras de cítricos y duce. Amargor al final.

Barwa pomarańczowa, piana trwała.
Aromat słodki, owocowy, tropikalny.
W smaku lekkie, owocowe, trochę słodkie, finisz bez goryczki.
Cloudy pineapple juice coloured with medium large head. Medium-bodied, soapy, fruity, grapefruity.
Bottle. Hazy orange appearance. Floral aroma with refreshing sweetness and bitterness. Quite similar to hoagaarden, but more complex taste.
Светлое. Заявлен вкус лимона, на деле привкус какого то шампуня. Если немного сойдёт пена, более менее. А так на фруктовое не особо похоже

Couleur orangée très trouble, limite opaque. Mousse décente sur la forme et assez endurante. Au nez on est sur l'orange et la coriandre dirais-je. En bouche la texture est assez smooth. On retrouve le duo orange et coriandre avec un côté poivré bien présent. Notes épicées globalement mais ouais, c'est pas mal poivré en fait. Amertume légère, carbo modérée. Une Belgian Wheat certes, mais pas lourde, ni sucrée, ni abusivement sur les levures, ni écoeurante. Ça casse pas trois pattes à un mouflon mais c'est tout à fait correct et ça se boit bien.

Aroma is sweet fruity, citrus, coriander, some floral notes. A lot of esters, almost like air refresher. Some candy.
Bitter citrus taste, some herbs and cloves.
More interesting than hoegaarden but almost the same level
Bevuta in bottiglia.  Tipica blanche, ma Americana. Profumata e buona. Leggera e fresca.

the aroma: fruity, floral, hints of sweet and bitter citrus, yeast, esters, candy, coriander and some other spices...
the taste: fruity, herbal, notes of bitter citrus, coriander, yeast, clove and some other spicy grasses...
the aftertaste: bitter, dry, spicy...

Słomkowe, mętne piwo o dość obfitej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w formie pierścionka przy brzegu szkła. Aromat kolendry, przypraw, pszenicy. W smaku lekko kwaśne i lekko słodkie, czuć trochę pomarańczy i kolendry. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie całkiem udany witbier, ma wszystkie cechy stylu, ale też niczym się nie wyróżnia.
Flaska från SB. Amerikansk belgisk öl som är gjord i Tjeckien och såld i Sverige. Parfym och tvål så det sticker. Njae...

Pomarańczowozłote, mętne, ładna piana, skromny lacing. W aromacie nuty pszeniczne, przyprawy, owoce, lekko zaciągnęło sztucznawą perfumowatością. W smaku lekko słodkie, przyprawowe, przyjemnie rześkie. 5,5 za aromat, 6,5 za smak.
Barwa bursztyn, mętne, piana dość gęsta, ładnie oblepia szkło. W aromacie dominuje słodka guma balonowa, świeży, kwiaty. W smaku kwiaty, guma balonowa. Wysokie wysycenie. Goryczki brak.
Cuerpo medio, aroma a cítricos y naranja , cuerpo medio, encaje ligero, carbonatacion media.
Tap. Hazy deep golden color with a thin head. Aroma of wheat and coriander. Sweet taste. Medium body.

Achetée à Leclerc de Sarlat en vacances. 
Blanche de type belge, honnête dans le style.
Pretty decent, strong acidic Citrus taste, like him, and decent drinkability.
Svært god hveteøl med mye kullsyre, uklar, lite alkohol, deilig avslutning og ingen bitterhet.

Colore giallo torbido, schiuma abbondante, morbida e persistente.
Al naso agrumi.
Carbonazione appena percettibile.

★★★½
Une bière qui se boit doucement.
Cher journal... En ce dîner virtuel du vendredi, je me dois de garder le contrôle de mon esprit dérangé. C'est pourquoi j'y vais avec cette petite bière légère qui se boit bien et tranquillement. On est loin des bonnes bières belges, c'est comme la Coor's Light ... Encore une fois, ils ne l'ont pas l'affaire les Américains.
Enjoyed in a bar from a tap.  Hazy orange color with stable white head. Aroma of citrus, orange peel and wheat. Taste is medium bitter with fruity notes, well balanced and easy to drink. A good one.

Pours a hazy orange colour with large white frothy head 
Notes of banana and citrus fruits
A sweet bitter aftertaste 
Bottle version

Hazy golden color with thick off-white head. Aroma has coriander, yeast, wheat and banana. Taste is malty sweet with long quite sweet aftertaste. Flavors of coriander, wheat, citrus and some fruity notes.

Soft, sour orange aroma. Maybe almost a metallic taste with a malty, orange-like. Slightly bitter on the finish. Texture is thin, and fairly thin. Drinkability is really high, but this isn't my thing. I think there are representatives that are better of this particular style. Any way, I'm not giving up on the style, but will not be going back to this.
Average witbier with a nice aroma. Rich body. Too sour for me, could be sweeter

Cold on a hot day.
Smell- weak citrus, weak acidic.
Foam- thin, malt, wheat, some yeast. Head is large, white color.
Appearance- brewer bottle cap, nice looking one actually. Other than that simple, but not ugly. Hazy, yellow-orange color, weak carbonation on sides and medium inside.
From - Weizen glass
Taste - citrus, some yeast, malt, wheat, faint banana. Feels unimpressive, yet simple and refreshing enough. Something is off in aftertaste.
Cerveja âmbar. Aroma doce, frutado e cítrico, levemente alcoólico. Sabor doce, forte presença laranja, doce, frutado. Refrescante
Morbida e densa. Scura e non filtrata, schiumosa. Anche se di base commerciale, non delude.
Ljust gyllene gult. Kraftigt grumlad vätska och ett gråvitt skum. Liten doft av våt disktrasa. Smakar definitivt av något som legat i städskåpet. Denna var inte angenäm någonstans.

Almost orange, hazy and not much foam

Metal, orange, tart, orange cream, biscuit, tangerine, sweet malt

Nice tight carbonation, sweet tart with great length, slight licorice, tangly yet creamy smooth, refreshing, nutty
Para mi gusto la mejor belgian White del mercado. Aromas y matices muy cítricos pero para nada una cerveza amarga, ligera  y a la vez con cuerpo . Entra sola

Head: Beautiful large head, but dissipated in a couple of minutes. A thin white rim remained.
Colour: Hazy amber.
Aroma: Oranges, sourdough starter, slightly metallic.
Taste: Nothing comes through for two seconds due to the tingly fizz and the beer feels watery. Mild notes of oranges come through for the next two seconds. Finally, the real texture (medium body) of the beer comes through and it suddenly finishes with an amazing creamy, nutty taste of wholesome home made bread that lingers. After 10-15 minutes, oxidised sourness overtakes everything else and is not as pleasant to drink.
Carbonation: High, very tingly, refreshing.

Dégustée le 2019-07-31. Belgian Moon Belgian White                                                                                                                                                                           .

330 ml can. Pours clear deep golden with soapy head. A: light caramel, dried fruits, T: light medium carbonated, medium body, quite malty, with hoppy finish, grapefruits, strong bitterness

330 ml bottle. Pours hazy golden with minimal head. A: clove, orange, T: thin body, medium carbonation, Wheaty, clove, slightly astringent

Hazy orange colour with medium white head. Head quickly dissipating. Aroma of oranges, coriander, fruity. Taste sweet and sour, with low bitterness. Oranges noticeable, overally easy drinking. Better than expercted.

# 1925; 3/2020. Malty, grainy, floral and spicy aroma. Amber, cloudy body, white head. Malty, grainy, orange-citrusy fruitiness, dryer finish. Medium body with creamy texture. Good Wit. 0,33 l, bottle, market, Pilsen (Bohemia, CZ).

330 ml bottle. Pours cloudy amber, rich white head. Aroma of esters, slight banana, orange peel, spices, overripe fruits. Taste is sweet, low bitterness. Flavors of ripe fruits, wheat, nuances of coriander, notes of spices. Spices and slight coriander notes in the aftertaste. Medium body, smooth texture, average to low carbonation.
I wouldn't consider myself a fan of the style but I enjoyed this one. Pleasantly refreshing and tasty with a great mouthfeel.
Svetla zakalena barva, minimalni pena. Vune po nejakym koryandru ci cem, trochu psenice. Chut nasladla, koryandrova, pomeranciva taky trochu, bylinky. Hutnejsi ale osvezujici
Botella. Hazy deep golden, medium white head. Fruit and spices with wheat in the aroma. Soft ok palate. Flavour: Wheaty and fruity with some spice to it, orange comes along too.

Żółte, zamglone, piana biała, drobna i trwała, nagazowanie w szkle pracuje. Aromat curacao, kolendra, lekki cytrus nuty zbożowe dość klasycznie. W ustach dość wytrawnie i orzeźwiająco nasycone, ale z przyjemnie kremową pianą. W smaku dużo kolendry i wyraźnie przyprawowy, wręcz pikantny finisz. Taki wit mi pasuje.
Równomiernie zmętnione, sporo cytrusów i kolendry. Słodkie, niskie wysycenie, fajny wit na wiosnę/lato

Barwa jasnozłota, zmętnione, piana biała, dość obfita, dość trwała. W aromacie kolendra, skórka pomarańczy. W smaku dość wytrawne, czuć kolendrę, podbudowę pszeniczną, gładkość, nutkę pomarańczy. Wysycenie i ciało w normie. Piwo jest wyważone. Udany Wit.
Cloudy orange colour with a white head,a light peppery orange and coriander aroma, light to medium body zesty orange and coriander flavour
Hazy and bubbly on pour, with a fluffy white head. Lots of wheat aromas, with a touch of orange. Lots of citrus flavours, but overall feels smooth and refreshing.
Una cerveza cítrica pero agradable al paladar. Deja un amargo suave al final, es suave y ligera.
Pachnie pięknie i rześko, wygląd delikatnie mętna pomarańcza, niestety dosyć słodkie.

Bottle at home, köszi Panni! Pours opaque orangeish golden with white head. Nose is bubblegum-like orange, low spices, some esters. Taste is low esters, grains, some orange in the finish. Short finish, light body, soft to average carbo.
Butelka 0,33 litra, zakupiona w Careffour. Barwa brudnej pomarańczy, przypominająca sok. Niska i mało trwała, biała piana. Całkiem ladne belgiskie klimaty w zapachu. W smaku trochę mydlane. Soczkowe.
Aroma : Medium toasted wheat, light bready malt, touch of orange citrus and some light herby/grassiness.  Taste : Pretty much as aroma. Clean & fresh, light bitternes. O.K. but nothing special.

Really great wibier. In the beginning little scared about the ratings but now im very happy with this beer.
The aroma is moderate with some metallic nose but the taste is decent. Lemons, and many fruits here. Very refreshing beer too. Also the carboration is not too hard and the beer give you great mouthfeel.
Overall one decent witbier to drink.

Mocno zmętnione, jasnopomarańczowe, piana średnio obfita, drobne i średnie pęcherzyki, zostawia lacing.
W aromacie skórka pomarańczowa, pszenica, kolendra.
W smaku pszenica, kolendra, skórka pomarańczowa, wytrawne, kremowe, nieco mineralne.
Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie, pełnia bardzo niska, nieźle pijalne.
Hazy orange color, good creamy mouthfeel. Very light bitternes, notes from both orange and coriander and a light aftertaste. Alright but nothing special.

Bit tarty notes in the aroma with a signs of wheat malt fleshed out with white fruitiness, bit corriander and yeasty base. Taste is the long run is bit soapy – with orange, banana and spicy corriander note. Not bad but there's lack of refreshment here.

Pours yellow colour with a small white head.  Aroma of orange, lemon, banana. The orange domination is clear, and it's very apparent in the taste also, as well as coriander. A little bit watery, but not unpleasantly.
A modern classic. This was the first beer I ever genuinely enjoyed, and it continues to be enjoyed to this day.
Trochę pustawy, nieco mydlany, ale wciąż solidny typowy witbier. Belgia w lekko wykastrowanej wersji. Jeśli ktoś lubi witbiery, będzie nawet zadowolony, choć szału ni mo.

22 ounce draft at Beef O Brady’s in Stow Ohio. Smell sweet wheat. Cloudy golden with orange tint. Thin white head. Taste the sweet wheat. Smooth and light. Sweet aftertaste. One of the better basic beers out there. Cheers!
Bardzo dobra prezencja. W aromacie cytrusy, kolendra, aromaty chmielowe mało wyczuwalne. Gładkie, przyprawowe, umiarkowanie słodkie, delikatna goryczka i lekka kwaskowość.

Wygląd: Jasno pomarańczowe, nieprzejrzyste zupełnie. Piana fajna wysoka o wyraźnych oczkach zdobi szkło.

Aromat: Słodowy, czuć brzoskwinię, mandarynkę  i skórkę pomarańczową.

Smak: Orzeźwiający, półwytrawny finisz. Poza tym w smaku pszeniczne, pomarańczowe, delikatnie landrynkowe, ale nie przesadnie, wysycenie przyjemne, musujące.

Ogólnie: Dobry średniak z nutą pomarańczową, jest Ok.

Jasne żółto brzoskwiniowe. Mętne. Piana średnia, szybko opada jak na witbier. Bananowo goździkowy aromat. Ziołowo sosnowy posmak. Kwaskowe. Niska słodycz i jeszcze niższa goryczka. Nic powalającego. Rodzime browary lepiej radzą sobie z gatunkiem
Gentle citrusy aroma, little yeasty, and tiny bit of herbs. In taste dry, yeast flavour, some orange peel and some white bread flavour.

Prezencja bardzo dobra. 
Mętna pomarańcza. Mętność w stylu mlecznym. 
Piana średnio spora. Biała i drobna. Dobrze oblepia szkło. 
Aromat witbirowy. 
Gładkie. Pełne i puszyste. Przyprawowe. 
Duża zbozowość i cytrusy. Kwaskowe i wysycone. Z delikatną goryczką. 
Przyjemny witek.
Piana drobna kolor złoto-mętny w zapachu czuć cytrusy, w smaku przebijają cię kwaśne cytrynowe przyjemne nuty , Piwo zakupione w Lidlu.

Opaque, straw colored beer with high head. Quite steady.
Distinctive lemon aroma.
High sweetness, no bitterness.
Almost full body. Medium carbonation.
Color dorado, un poco oscuro. Un aroma un tanto herbal y un tanto picante. Con ligeros toques a naranja.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

A very light and airy sort of ale with a very slight creamyness that fizzles away rather quickly after swallowing. The aftertaste is hoppy and mild.

It is certainly not the best I've ever had, but it does wash down well with some snacks when you are jonesing for something on a warm day.

Keg at the Three Frogs, Wokingham in 2012. We all know what it is. It’s not the worst beer in the world, but masquerading as craft beer it most certainly is. Honestly, when one can just get Hoegaarden, what’s the point in Blue Moon? It’s like a diluted version of a wit. Thanks, but no thanks, to the wedge of citrus fruit too.
Decent Belgian style wit. Very smooth and creamy. A little banana in the background. Slice of oranges round it out with a bit of citrus.
Poměrně nečekaně slušný psenicny ale. Vadila mi divná horká chuť koriandru a pomeranče. Verze staropramenu.

(bottle 0,33l) Overall: Refreshing, drinkable, a bit too much coriander.
 Aroma: Strong coriander, sweet, herbal/spicy (reminds beer-spa salts).
 Appearance: Cloudy orange. Minimal white head.
 Taste: Strong coriander, medium sweet, orange peel, some herbal, light spicy, light bitter.
 Palate: Light-medium body. Bitter, light spicy finish.
Delicious, has a subtle orange/ citrus aroma that compliments well a classic Belgian style beer. Nice and light to the taste and an easy beer to drink all night.
Lys, lett tåkete med noen sedimenter i bunn, koriander, banan, frisk, men tynn
Can’t believe I didn’t review this famous beer. Review in ewk terminal for aa. Won’t tip the bartender. It’s the worst service I have had.

This beer scared me from ever drinking blue moon again. It was an alright beer, if it was there I would drink it, but one time drinking Belgium white I took a drink there was a chunk of something in there. I damn near threw up

tastes like a belgian white was diluted 50/50 with a coors. sweet smelling cheap corn and wheat with old orange peels or orange flavoring maybe faint spice. flavor is the same - sweet brew of cheap stale corn and wheat with weird orange flavor - not getting nice yeasty funk, savory wheat or peppery spice or anything youd expect from a good white ale. cloying orange flavor and stale grain aftertaste - bottom of the list for this style...how is this at all popular?

Somehow I never got around to rating this one. Seems I've had it many times over the years but never bothered to note it. Well here it is in Cyprus on tap of all places! Has medium cloudy body and modest foam, sharp coriander aroma. Flavour is orange citrus and coriander. Crisp finish. Unique and reliable, must be why it's so ubiquitous.

Dirty yellow-orange with no head.
Smell of wheat and orange peels. Oaty and wheaty taste with an orange candy component, like Fruitella Orange, and a coriander note. Low carbonation.
Rather stale this beer.
330 ml bottle. Pours hazy yellow with white head.  Aroma is coriander, wheat, oranges. Flavor is coriander, wheat, oranges, banan, cloves, citrus.
Bottle. Hazy orange color. Medium size, off-white head, stays. Sweet, coconut, sugary, honey, wheaty in aroma/taste. Happens.
Hazy orange pour. Citrus nose. Wheaty, sweet, loads of zest and citrus. Ok white

Citrusna aroma, poput nekakve pomorandže, pomalo kao mango. Lep izgled, mutno, maglovito. Ukus isto pomalo citrusan, kiselkast poput pomorandže, osjeća se pśenice. Jako lep osjećaj u ustima, pecka za nepce pomalo. Odličan aftertaste. Kupila sam u rodu jer nisam imala para za pljeskavicu, ostavila da se ladi i otišla po pljeskavicu sa novcima za pljeskavicu. Odlično prelepo iskustvo. Boca 330ml. 
7.5

Nose. Bright, coriander, orange and some white bread.
Taste. Dense body, Taste spicy orange, in something pastry shop. The aftertaste is a little astringency from the zest and notes of “spicy oranges”

Ar: niesamowite mango, mega soczysto, super intensywnosc, odrobina kolendry i banana, wow. Wyg: Zlotawe, lekko zmetnione, piana ultra drobna, cienka. Sm: soczyste mango, brzoskwinia, owocowo, kolendra, lekkie banany, wysycenie niskie, konkret drozdze. Pos: slodko, tropikalnie, mango, kolendra. Ov: swietne, soczyscie, naturalnie, intensywnie.
This is my go to beer. I love the wheat beers with the slight orange flavor

I do not typically enjoy hazy beers, but Blue Moon is an exception. It has a very enjoyable flavor thanks to the orange peel. It doesn't much resemble other wheat beers I've tried IMO, but its enjoyable nonetheless. Its a pass. Not bad, but not amazing.
Bottle, 2019/09/11. Closer to a spiced soup than a proper enjoyable witbier. First and last time.
bière blanche légère et fruitée . Dommage qu'elle manque un peu de persistance et que la mousse fasse trop industrielle.
Blue moon is a Belgian style beer. It has a good balance of citrus orange sweetness with peppery and spicy flavor. A bit thick and chewy for the style, but nice carbonation.
Not a pure wiess  beer but a very good hazy wheat ale. I like the orange peel that is added. A great beer to start off with.

AR: belgische Hefe, pfeffrig, Getreide, Zitrus, Koriander, Orange, seifig, blumig
AP: milchigflockiges (orange)goldgelb
TA: belgische Hefe, Orange, cremig, seifig, blumig

Thuis uit een flesje. Verwarrend, het etiket vermeld dat dit in Tsjechië gebrouwen is? Troebel okergele kleur, bijna oranje. Matig schuim. Goede zoete smaak, banaan. Doet eerder denken (en dat is positief) aan een Duitse weizen, dan aan een Belgisch wit bier. Lekker.

Lovely citrus aroma and taste, mostly orange. Easily drinkable. Prefer without the orange offered at times as it tends to overpower the drink. Becoming widely available which I am more than happy with.

Also tasted Blue Moon at the Coors factory in Colorado and the taste was far superior to that of the bottled or tap versions.
overall a nice one, new to tasting beers and i found this one very likeable.

I am not keen on the wit style, but this beer has something special. It is the orange taste and a bitter aftertaste that hardly can someone leave unnoticed.  Excellent hazy orange colour. I always drink this beer with a slice of orange.

330 glass bottle at family gathering. Poured into weizen glass, fridge cold. Maybe have originated from multipack as I couldn’t find any date on the bottle. 

Pours a orange hazy colour, huge head, just off white. Lots of big bubbles. The head takes quite some time to settle to a one finger heavy head. 

The aroma has an upfront hit of bitter orange peel that peters out over time. Some lemon, some wheat, and coriander. All a little muted in comparison to some of the better examples of the style. 

The taste is bitter and slightly spicy but the wheat dominates. As with the aroma the orange peel dies out as the beer warms. 

In the mouth the beer has a medium level of carbonation, but feels thin. Wheaty and light bitter aftertaste that doesn’t last in the mouth very long. 

Overall, an average example of the style. Refreshing but not memorable.
Przeciętny witbier, trochę za słodki, brak orzeźwienia, na szczęście kolendra na akceptowalnym poziomie.

Copenhagen 18/8 2019. 33 cl bottle from Meny, Østerfælled Torv, Kbh Ø. Simple label in two shades of blue. Advertising that it is brewed "with Orange Peel for a Refreshing Citrus Taste". 

Pours murky orange with a medium-sized white head. Bubbly. Settles as very thin patch of foam. Not even close to cover the surface of the beer. No lacing. 

Aroma is balanced between a fruity sweetness and tart, citric notes. Sweet Oranges and Peach. Tart not of Gooseberry and currants. Citrus and Lemon. More tart than Sweet.

Light carbonation. Thin, watery, slightly sticky texture. 

Flavor is medium sweet followed by a moderate tart, sourish bitterness. Aftertaste is tart, mildly sour. A bit thin. Lingers shortly.

A bit thin and Generic take on a Witbier.

A light and cloudy beer with strong citrus flavours provide the drinker with a crisp and deep refreshing beverage perfect for a summers afternoon. Towards the bottom of the barrel the drink can become quite soapy tasting, however, generally this pint is a solid call. I have only ever had it in England so I am unsure as to how it compares with the US version however I am a great advocate of this pint.

I've now tasted this beer in both the USA and in the UK and there is an enormous difference.  The American version is, as advertised, of Belgian style and with orange/citrus flavours, like Hoegaarden but more orange.  The British version is darker, with a heavier style, and very little citrus flavour.  It's perfectly drinkable but not like the original.  I suspect that this is due to it's being brewed in the UK, and one might speculate that the US brewery has access to cheap orange rinds whereas these have to be imported into the UK at some expense.  I've noticed a similar issue with other UK versions of Blue Moon beers, they really don't approach the experience of drinking the American product.

33 cl can (BBD 2019-06-30), bought from The Forest (B93 8JA), drunk at home 2019-08-12.

Appearance is a very hazy deep gold with a thick, dense white head that lingers. Some visible carbonation but nowhere near as much as I was expecting.

Aroma is fine. Not particularly strong but quite pleasant. Citrus (orange and lemon if forced to choose) notes are most prominent, but there's also some grassy hints a maybe a touch of spice.

Taste is okay. Surprisingly sweet, even for a wheat beer, with orange notes coming through at the end. Honey hints as well with maybe a touch of spice on the finish. A bit unbalanced with the sweetness.

Palate is fine. Just edging towards medium-bodied with very little carbonation in the mouth, but very juicy with a surprisingly smooth medium-length finish.

Overall, it's Blue Moon. There's not a massive amount I can say about it that hasn't already been said. A good introduction to the style for new drinkers, but I'd like it less sweet and pushing through some more of the estery flavours that make a really good wheat beer.
Not an export,  but this is a good beer.  Smooth and frothy goes down nice and like package says made with orange peels you can taste the citrus in it.

Family Mart summer beer campaign, 500ml. can. Aroma: rather acidic, strawberries. Appearance: opaque amber, no head to speak of. Palate: lightly bitter, soft carbonation, lacks any noticeable finish. Taste: rather weak.

Easily one of my favourite beers! Served with a slice of fresh orange! 

On draught this beer is out of this world! Much better than it is from the bottle in my opinion.. with a creamy head when served on draught! 

Never fails to please!

Colore giallo limone tendente al dorato, piuttosto opaca. Versa due dita di schiuma che svaniscono velocemente. Aroma di malto, crosta di pane, lievito con sentori di frutti estivi. In bocca risulta meno complessa rispetto all'aroma, in evidenza soprattutto la componente dolce del malto e dei lieviti. Birra semplice e beverina.

Citrus aroma, a bit malty, less bitter, kind of sweet and medium body.
Good balance and easygoing.
Dark amber in colour. Fruity esters should be low to none. White head quickly vanished. Creamy. Smooth and clean.
Uma whitte refrescante, aroma e sabor citrico bem marcantes. Cor dourada turva e espuma branca.
An unusual yet average tasting beer with hints of orange. Not a fan of the aftertaste. Quite dry.

Bottle @ Friends/Dr yeast. Appearance: pours hazy yellow with ok white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, wheat, bread, light orange peel, light coriander and grass notes. palette: medium malty and yeasty aroma, average carbonation, medium body, medium sweetness, somewhat balanced by a light to medium bitterness, average duration and a watery texture. Overall: refreshing light spiced wit
Непрозрачное, слегка кисловатый витбир. Кориандр и апельсин особо не чувствуются, есть немного свежего хлеба.
Blanche rafraîchissante, une belle descente d'épices en fond de gorge, petite bulles

I thought that marketing this beer to be drunk with an orange was for safety, to cover an undesirable taste, like a labourer wearing a high vis vest on a job site. Instead, it’s to add a distinguishing note to the otherwise-bland palate and lack of depth, like a labourer wearing a high vis shirt on their day off.
Przyzwoity witbier, wyraźnie czuć dodatki. Niestety w tle jakiś nieprzyjemny posmak.
33 cl fles. Troebel oranje van kleur, fijne witte  schuimkraag. De geur is muf en koriander. Smaak is zoet, curaçaoschil, tarwe en haver. Medium lichaam, veel koolzuur.

Beers of the summer at family mart.. Wuxing. Clean and easy to drink. Not as cloying or sickly as kronenbourg white. That said it doesn't have the depth of a real white beer. Not as rounded as an erdinger nor does it have the full flavor of the wenheistephaner... Sorry about the spelling I'm on my mobile. The fact that it is fruity and clean means it is a better summer beer than the former tho. Overall, a good entry level white beer. Great in summer
Orange color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.
Pours hazy gold, nice white cream head. Aroma is orange, soap and vanilla. Sam flavours on the palate, low carbonation and low spice. Smooth.

I once drank Blue Moon occasionally, hardly ever now.  I had this serving in a tall pilsner glass with a slice of orange at an upscale restaurant.  The appearance is appealing, cloudy orange with a firm top of white bubbles.  I have a smell, orange peel.  And the taste is, no surprise, a subdued orange, grain, honey and just a bare touch of spiciness.

I think beer is absolutely disgusting. I really mean that. In all honesty this is the best beer I have ever had. I enjoy it with a organic orange. They really hit a home run with this beer. I haven’t had the luxury to try and outher blue moon beer just bc I enjoy this one so much. Cheers!
Can, first in many years. Citrus and coriander aroma, quite tasty and easy spice and citrus, kind of a thin body but it’s smooth and approachable, carbonation medium to high, passable wit style.
Lovely cloudy wheat ale, nothing quite like it. Always pass on the orange slice.
Drunk from bottle. Aroma of soap, malt. Soapy palate. Lively carbon. Sort of bitter. Messy.

Pours a cloudy light orange/gold with a lasting thin head. Aroma of Light spices, wheat and lemon. Flavor is wheat beer with orange, coriander and light spices. Slightly spicy, lightly bitter dry finish.
First time trying that refreshing masterpiece. Garnished with a slice of orange. Aroma is citrusy and light. Refreshing on the mouth and bitter but not much. Very summery and truly an experience.

Color naranja, muy turbia, translúcida. Espuma blanca de más de un dedo de espesor y buena retención. Aroma a cereales blancos, naranja, piel de naranja y herbal. Sabor en esa línea, la naranja un poco más amarga y la mezcla con la sensación herbal me resulta artificial. Textura casi sedosa. Carbonatación media alta.
Coriander aroma is amazing, lots of different aromas, various flavours. Great wheat beer

Citrus aroma, probably from the slice of orange it was served with. Thin mouth feel, not like the pillowy deliciousness you'd expect from the style. Strange bitterness reminiscent of a commercial larger.
Giant can at Yankee Stadium. From can. Bread, coriander, banana, clove, little synthetic orange. Light body. Fine.
Iznenađujuće ukusno i pitko pivo, skoro narančaste boje, skoro bez pjene... ali jako ukusno! Preporuka

One pint can. Pours a bright cloudy orange gold with a big tight white head that is persistent. Big scents of yeast bubblegum and bananas. Very mild wheat beer tastes. Short crisp finish. Medium carbonation.
Corona de espuma blanca con poca retención. Cuerpo ligero más bien acuosa.  Muy floja de sabor. Cierto regusto a piel de naranja pero nada rico.

Pours a small head. Easy to sip through,  with hints of orange and butter. Goes down well, is definitely a comfort beer; I can imagine sipping through one of these on a cold day while having a chat with a mate. A little too dense to bury a bunch in the one session. Overall a good pick if you're looking for something different.

Colore non così chiaro come ci si potrebbe aspettare, molto torbido ma non è un difetto. La schiuma chiara è media e abbastanza evanescente. Carbonazione media.
Sensazioni olfattive di frumento e agrumi, soprattutto coriandolo; il luppolo resta sullo sfondo così come in bocca.
Gusto rotondo dato dal perfetto bilanciamento in cui anche l’avena dice la sua. Non si discosta troppo da una blanche classica, si possono percepire coriandolo e arancia. Corpo medio, un pelo acquosa.
Buona persistenza gustativa, il finale è leggermente amaro.
Birra fresca, da abbinare a farmi bianchi e pesce. Più che adatta per un aperitivo!

Pours cloudy with thin head.

Citrus and hoppy smell.

Slight bitterness on tongue, lots of flavor but not particularly nice ones.

Robe orangée, avec le trouble caractéristique du froment, plus un peu de levure. Belle mousse rousse, moyennement tenace. Nez très expressif, avec plein de coriandre, des notes levurées, fort agréable. En bouche, c'est presque mielleux et brioché, avec toujours une forte présence de la coriandre, pour un ensemble très gourmand qui me plaît bien. Pas mal de rondeur tout en restant léger. Une très bonne witbier, à mon goût, surtout pour une indus.
Versa un nebuloso giallo scuro con una piccola testa bianca. L'aroma è un grano sottile e un po 'di caramello.
Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Shady golden, medium white head. Perfumy, artificial spicy aroma. Dry, low to mediumbitterness.
Bottle from Tesco. Cloudy golden appearance with foamy white head. Aroma is wheat and malts. Flavour is wheat, spiced and citrus.
On tap at Courtyard by Marriot Los Angeles/LAX. Hazy golden with a small white head. Light with citrus, some yeast and light wheat. Drinkable but nothing to write home about.

Very smooth and deceptively potent .
I prefer it at room temperature  . I find it brings out the flavours better
Fiskåbanen 010219. Golden-orange color with a white head. Aroma is coriander, wheat, oranges. Flavor is coriander, wheat, oranges, banan, cloves, citrus. Nice beer.
One of my least favorite beers. Im intrigued  buy first one or two sips and then it just nasty. Kinda like eating  german chocolate cake thats so good its sickening  to finish it.
Fles 33cl gedeeld bij The Holland Tringham in Londen. Wat zoetig, wat weeïg, weinig uitgesproken, geel fruit. (9-2-2019).
Cloudy yellow hazy big head which disappears quickly smell of wheat not much smell to it taste of wheat citrus lemon
Not worth reviewing properly. Not going to finish it. Smells weak but fine. Tastes like urine and chemicals. Easy drinking sure but what's to like?

The nose of the beer is characterised by honey undertones and a wheaty top note, while the legs of the beer suggest a low alcohol content. Indeed, the alcohol content is low so that checks out. A great beer, makes me think of a sunny farm and honeysuckle. Because of the honey undertones and wheaty top note which I mentioned before in a previous sentence.

A very smooth and well finished wheat ale. Aroma is slightly fruity. Tastes like any wheat ale, smooth and mild but by no means watery. Hints of orange peel and very faint diacetyl fruitiness. Finish is smooth. Has a very creamy feel on the palate. Overall a very nice beer
Cloudy yellow with creamy foam.   Slight banana aroma.  Sweet wheat taste with a spicy finish.  Nice for the style, not overly sweet
Refreshing, Citrusy, served with a slice of orange, easy drinking, made in America but is based on an Indian pale ale
One of my favourites, lovely notes of orange peel, hazy and smooth. I prefer this by the pint if I’m honest, I find a lot of the bottles have floaters in and have less of a smoother finish.
Shared bottle, thanks to Harald. Pours hazy weak golden, big creamy white head. Weak aroma and taste, there is some cloves and weak citrus, nothing more

Extraordinaria cerveza, color opaco similares a las cervezas Schufferhoffer y Hoegaarden pero que quedo con Blue moon un sabor con toques a naranja.
altamente recomendada. 👍👍👍

This was my first fav and my go to summer beer. It’s a relax in the creek or by the pool with an orange. When you are getting past the urine you drank in college, this is a nice wheat to start out with

@ Havregatan 20181207. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget.
Wheaty and fruity, citrusy and light spicy, estery and sweet, light to medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry.
16oz at the Las Vegas airport. Aroma is orange, light hops. Appearance is cloudy yellow with a small white foam. Taste is sweet and light sour. Good.
Nearly every time I buy this beer, it has floaters. It really ruins the entire experience for me.

Flasche 0,355l: Golden, leicht bräunlich, kräftige Trübung, kräftiger stabiler feinporiger Schaum; sehr frische + sehr fruchtige Nase, kräftige fruchtige Süße, Zitrusnoten, exotische Früchte, Orangen, Karotten, Malz, Getreide, kräftige Hefearomen, Hopfenaromen; fruchtiger + frischer Körper, Zitrusnoten, fruchtig-trockene Säure, kräftige Hefearomen, Malz, Getreide, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, trockene Hopfennoten; angenehmer fruchtig-trockener Nachgang

Tap. Golden yellow, misty, white foam. Aroma: fruity, citruses with its peel, slightly grapes, vanilla, sweet, light spice. Taste: sweetish, citrus peel, light spice, bubblegum, wheat, fruit, vanilla.
Cerveza con una gran cabeza blanca que desaparece a los pocos segundos. Tiene aroma a cereal, levadura y trigo. Del sabor se destaca un sabor cítrico, además de pan y cereales.

Awesome mass produced Belgian white beer. Love the fact that it's one of the few unfiltered beers that are generally available. Love mine with with orange slice or orange juice if not available. TIP: To kick it up a notch you can add triple sec and make a few beers last all day :)
Great Belgium white nice wheat beer taste with sweet orange and coriander flavour a really smooth refreshing this is one of my favourite beers.

Cloudy light golden color with a medium white head that disappears instantly without lacing. Aroma of white cereal, wheat, flour and yeast with a very faint touch of citrus. Very artificial citric flavors, like lemon or orange, cereals, bread dough and herbal air freshener. Fairly light body, watery texture and medium-light carbonation. A disastrous take on the belgian witbier style, without the typical kick of gas and citrus that characterizes it and artificial flavors. It's easy to drink though, but isn't worth it.
Bouteille de  341 ml. Odeur pas très  agréable. Même  couleur  que les armoires de  ma cuisine.  Le goût d'un blanche commerciale.  Pas mauvaise mais il en a des meilleures.

오렌지향이 조금 남..
에델바이스와 블랑 비슷한 향긋함

블랑이 조금 더 나은 것 같기도..
블랑이나 에델바이스 그리고 호가든 보다는 확실히 향이 다르긴 한데 그래도 시트러스향에 은은하니 가격만 적당하면 언제든 다시 사 먹을 것 같아

Pint at the Grazing Harts, Mickelbring.
Medium creamy white head. Cloudy blond pour. OK.

This is in my top favorite 5 beers of all time. So good, especially out of a tap with fresh orange slice. Mmmm This is the beer that attracted me to wheat beers in the first place. Fortunately this is a very popular beer, so I can find it in most any bar. I often find myself falling back to this beer, as I have found only a handful of beers that I like as much.
Draft at the Union Bar, Gering, NE. Cloudy witbier with a fruity taste. Not the most exciting of its kind
Bottle. Malty aroma, light banana and corriander, orange peel. Tastea the same as aroma, light to medium bitter. Medium body, malty light bitter finish. Average.

33 cl can bought in Jasper Wine Cellar, Alberta, then enjoyed at Wapiti Campground under a magnificent rainbow by the Athabasca river. Beautiful day.


The beer pours a hue in between golden and lemon-yellow, with a white-ish head that starts thick and strong but wanes off rapidly to leave just a ring.


Aroma is cilantro (rather than coriander), bread dough, lemon. Mouthfeel is medium fizziness, medium to full body, crisp, watery, short-lasting, bitterless. Easy to drink, easy to forget.
Blue moon is unique. I believe if i insert this bottle up my anal cavity it will expulse a buffet of floral tenderness and love
My favourite go to beer really refreshing and fruity with a slice of orange perfect

I was expecting a little more from this but am satisfied overall. The smell has hints of citrus which differs from the typical aroma of beers at this price point. The color is a hazy yellow/ orange color. The taste is breadline, hearty, and top of with orange which gives it some character. It’s smooth and easy to drink for really any occasion. Since I’m a novice to the whole beer world, i am waiting for a beer with distinctly delicious flavor which I have yet to find, however, this is still a good beer.

bottle from a supermarket in tenerife.
hazy yellow, small white head.
aroma is chemical citrus, yeast, dough, faint herbal tea like bitter note.
flavor is quite bland, faint bitter herbal note, faint sweetness, faint coriander. faint lemongrass or lemin. most every belgian wit is a lot more tasty than this one imo.
Cloudy yellow colour, medium withe head, citrus aroma, sweet citrus flavour, medium body.
Lrkko metny kolor zlocisty, zapach slaby, smak lagodny, lekkie drozdze, ale nic specjalnego
I've had this on a few occasions and I am always left disappointed. I like white ales and I keep wanting this to work but the flavor is really lacking every time.

Bottle. Hazy honey yellow to orange colour. Small but well-lacing head. Aroma: fairly spicy. Fat coriander, orange zest. Wheat malt. Light to medium body. Soft carb. Taste. Your regular witbit but of spiciness that is totally out of balance. No elegance. No like.

Blanche de 5,4 % abv, issue du groupe Miller Coors.
Mon exemplaire était un peu après sa date.
Couleur ambré, avec un très léger voile.
Mousse qui tombe vite pour laisser la chose inerte.
Arômes de curaçao, cerise blanche.
De la première bouche à la dernière, vous avez l'impression
soit d'un radler de super marché, soit d'un panaché français
d'un autre grand groupe, soit d'une sans alcool qui peut se 
boire tout telle jusqu'au bout de la nuit .. (pour les malades).
Finale nullissime.
CONCLUSION : l'avantage de cette chose est de se mesurer
rapidement à l'aune de la faiblesse …
Grand groupe et tristesse du monde se ressemblent étrangement.
Cette blue moon me donne un coup de blues !!

Appearance: hazy golden, great head
Aroma: light spicy
Palate: medium full mouthfeel, medium carbonation
Taste: light spices, orange, wheat malt
Overall: really pleasant beer

Pour 12 oz bottle in Tokyo, appearance of yellow to orange with hazy, cloudy with half inch of foamy head, small bubble with no carbonation floating from the bottom.
Aroma of malt like bread with little hint of caramel and soy sauce, no significant hop aroma appeared.
Taste really light on sweetness and bitterness while sourness is not presented.
Mouthfeel, found light to medium body with moderate to high carbonation, little sticky but short and really can't find significant finish characteristic.
Overall, refreshing white beer to drink in the summer yet interesting note of white beer

Taste like a Bud. I have a headache already. Has an alcohol back-taste like cheap beer. I can hardly believe it’s in a bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.33 l bottle from K-Citymarket Ruoholahti, Helsinki (as "Belgian style wheat ale"). Brewed by Molson Coors Brewing Company UK ltd. Appearance is golden, cloudy and big head. Taste spice, actually very spicy compared to other witbiers. Tasty, not just a straight copy of Hoegaarden.

Can shared in Canada as "Belgian Moon".
Aroma is fruity, citrus.
Poured hazy blond with a huge white firm foam head.
Taste had fruit, citrus, sweet.
Light mouthfeel.

Bottle at home. Poured really cold with a cloudy and turgid appearance with little head. A strong aroma of yeast on the nose. The taste was yeasty with perhaps some malt coming through, but overall subdued. The mouthfeel however was as smooth as silk and this slipped down a treat on a blindingly hot day. Not much flavour, but great drinkability and very thirst quenching.

Bottle, 330 ml. Ok guys, this was waaaay too suspucious for me. First of all, the brand belongs to MolstonCoors, which owns shitloads of brands, but all the beers i've tasted from this conglomerate (or i don't really know what is it) are disaster: Coors light (sparky piss water), Norok (is this a beer, or a grey water from the shower?), Borsodi (Hungary's nightmare), Kamenitza (simply not good), Miller (this is not a beer), Canadian (R U kidding me?), Carling (very weak, kind of nothing lager), Caffrey's (the creamy water without any aromas and taste). The only good brand was Staropramen I've tasted recently. So i was very skeptic about this Blue Moon, i told to the beer shop girl not to order it, cz it's fake. And yes, i had right. This is a fake, plastic version of Belgian Witbier. It wants to be a Belgian Witbier but it can't, cz u can feel it it's just fake. Not bad anyway, but the head is weak, the aromas are weak too, the taste is overpowered by peach and nectarine, it wants to be a style too much that it's not. The aftertaste is good, but this is the only thing reminds me to quality Belgian. It smells of faking big time for me. Brewed in the UK anyway, so buy a real Belgian instead of this.
Bottle 330ml at holiday home.  BBE 2018-12-31. From K-citymarket Pirkkala. Malts, fruits, orange, spices, caramel, very sweet wit. Medium body, average carbonation.
Bartender told me this was "Belgian"... well.. Taste is very fruity, so is the aroma. Orange is dominant. Sweet and sour.

Schooner on tap at Doughbox, Brighton-Le-Sands. Sweet malt and cloves on the nose. Hazy amber beer with thin white head and light carbonation. Effervescent with good body. Finish is slightly bitter fruit with late sourness and spice. Perfectly acceptable Belgian clone.

While not bad it's convinced me that most American wheat beers are bigger flops than most Nick Cage films. This one is too soapy, smells like a tramp's sock and has a weird synthetic taste even if it proabably made with natural flavours. Has a coriander and orange flavour, once again not a patch on Germany or France's finest efforts. How it won any awards is anyone's guess - a lower bar than the one in Tinytown?
Had one of these after 10 years of avoidance. Could not finish. This beer introduced me into “craft beer”. I guess I’ll always be thankful for that.
Appearance- slightly cloudy golden, a half-finger white head. Aroma- corn, cereal, hint of orange, spices, malts. Taste- malts, lemon hints, cereal, cardboard, orange, slight spicy notes.
The wife doesn't drink beer i got her to try the Belgian White And she like it
Pivo izvrsnog mirisa i okusa. Veoma osvjezavajuce. Osjeti se naranca koja daje dodatnu draz. Umjerena gorcina

(paille trouble, nez pils, blé, ~pisse-cat, croustillante, ~onctueuse (oat), note light citron, ~acide-blanche, bof)
Pours amber to orange. Aroma is citric with hints of banana. Taste develops this concepts farther and adds some crisp and spiciness to it. Funky and refreshing. Dry finish.

No way would i even consider serving with fruit in the bloody glass. As it comes. If it needed slice then it would be added to flavouring...hhmmmm
Enjoyed this cold, very refreshing. Expecting worse due to ratings from higher ratees than myself. Refreshing and I could taste teh spiciness. I got mild Crabbie's like ginger beer in there - which was a nice surprise.

On draught at The Showman in Bloxwich.
I don't usually drink draught but so many people were drinking it i thought I'd have a taste.
Light, cloudy lager/beer. The slice of orange which is put in the beer tends to overpower the natural aroma and taste.
It's biggest plus point is this beer is very refreshing to drink to the point where you could easily drink 4-5 in an hour.
Pint from tap at The Lord Moon Of The Mall. Orange-like citrusy, refreshing, light beer

Schiuma cremosa di buona persistenza con bel colore giallo / arancio, quasi luminoso. Aroma fresco e con sentori di frutta fresca come mandarino, limone e fiori secchi. Sapore morbido e dolce con contenuto alcolico apparentemente assente. Corpo piuttosto "giovane" e decisamente acquoso. Potabile o poco di più.

From bottle (BB July'18) in weizen. Pours deep clear golden with 1-finger white head, aroma of citrus, yeast & undercurrent of grain. Forward orange zest taste I found this tastier than I expected (I've passed it by many times).

Bottle, 355ml. Pours cloudy yellow, not too much head and mostly diminishing. Some banana in the aroma, sweet hay, mostly unremarkable. Flavour develops the hints of banana much better, crisp, wheat, citrus quite present too. Very refreshing feel. Texture is somewhat watery, finish is somewhat sour and of average duration, body is medium. OK witbier.

Aroma: eher schwach. Wenig Hopfen.

"Belgian White Ale" (América del Norte) / "North American Craft Beer" (Reino Unido)
Elaborado con avena para obtener cremosidad y condimentado con la combinación perfecta de cáscara de naranja y cilantro.
Una cerveza de trigo sin filtrar especiada en la tradición belga para un sabor inusualmente suave.
Medallista de oro (cerveza blanca) en 1995 World Beer Championships, medallista de plata (cerveza blanca) en 1996 y 1997 World Beer Championships. 171 calorías por porción de 12 onzas y 5.4% de abv.
Nota del editor: Gran parte de la producción de esta cerveza ahora proviene de la cervecería Molson en Toronto. Una pequeña porción de la producción de Draft de Denver proviene de la fábrica de cerveza SandLot. Aún otro producto puede continuar siendo de Golden.

0,33 l bottle. This one was brewed in UK. Pours hazy yellow with a finger of dissipating white head. Aroma is pleasant, spices, coriander and orange peel, some wheat in the background. Flavor is full of spices and completely artificial. Almost like they brewed something and they threw in a bunch of artificial aromas. Body is light to medium sweet and medium bitter. Finish is quite long, spices dominate it, bitterness lingers for a while. Unfortunately it tastes very artificial.

Tall glass at Olive Garden. Pours hazy yellow with a think white head. The aroma is subtle orange with some hops. The flavor is orange with some wheat. Good everyday beer.

330ml bottle in Rome, drunk with dinner. Pours thickly cloudy with a thin frothy head that settled quickly, minimal lacing, no visible bead. Dirty mid straw in colour. Botella 33 cl XIV cata Ratebeer Asturias en Cimmeria 04..02..2018 (r3029). Color amarillento dorado turbio con poca  espuma blanca. Sabores frescos cereales especiados con toques herbáceos gengibre. Cuerpo ligero gas. Muy corriente.

Pivo u flaši. Kao prvo ne volim kad se "marketinški"  navlači potencijalne kupce. U ovom slučaju to je u njegovu nazivu. To nije "Belgijsko" pivo , nego pšenićno pivo Belgijskog stila koje je napravljeno u S.A.D-u , i na flaši treba pisati samo Witbier ..al' pustimo to.
Ukratko o ovom Witbieru.   
Aroma je slatkasta i korijanderasta.

Not bad, but not good. Hazy orange brown. Grainy aroma. Orange on grain on the tongue. A little creamy feel.
On tap. Cloudy gold with a thin white head. Aromas of citrus and yeast. Fresh bready flavor with a bit of citrus, spice and cut grass. Lingering yeasty flavors. Very easy drinking. Not bad.
16oz can. Light, citrusy and easy to down. good stuff. Smells and looks like watered down orange juice. Refreshing on a hot summer day in the future.

Can - pours a clouded light gold with a puffy 1 finger white cap which lasts well and laces the glass walls. Aroma of pungent cereals, light coriander seed notes and lemon grass, clean aroma. Flavor is biscuit malts with coriander-spicy balance, fair bittering - goes to spicy, lightly bitter dry finish. Dusty biscuit malt character, smooth and restrained, coriander not overpowering, dry, refreshing but satisfying - decent enough witbier, not over the top, if it had a fult it's that it was too mellow and rounded and te carbonation was not natural - I was surprised this came from Molsons.

Soft on the palette. Nice aroma. Fresh on the tongue to start with but the refreshing starts to die down half way through the bottle.

1/6/18
With Abby about to Watch the Empire Strikes Back. 
Poured from bottle. 

Hazy almost opaque orange with a 1 finger white head. 

Smell is sweet wheat and fruity. 

Taste is really sweet from the wheat with a fair presence of yeasty spice (coriander?). Definitely taste the orange too. It’s yummy. 

Feel is pretty thick for the abv. Really solid here.

Overall I like it. One of my favorite macro beers and super easy drinking.

A servir impérativement avec une rondelle d’agrume doux (orange, mandarine) pour sublimer la bière sinon beaucoup moins d’intérêt. Bière rafraîchissante très parfumée (agrumes, coriandre). Pours a darkish golden, with a very large white head. Aromas of orange, zest, yeast and a little banana. Tastes of mostly orange, with the slightest amount of hops. Very thick, wheaty body with a nice, smooth refreshing finish. Not bitter.

This is one of my favorite lower end beers (along with Steam Whistle), it tastes great and isn't all that expensive. It's definitely far better than the beers of the same price (Coors, Bud Light, Stella, etc) and I'd recommend it.
yumm yumm, will never buy but will always take when offered. spicy simple and easy to drink

33cl bottle. Pours hazy gold with persistent white foam, very fine. Aroma is orange peel and spices. Body is light with moderate carbonation. Taste is generally sweet, with a tart feeling, mostly giving an industrial, artificial flavour. Finish is average, again light.

not much taste, almost as if it is water. not bad, just not real good. 

7/2021 update -  still dont care for the cloudy look, the taste- right out of the bottle and in the glass - is ok, but soon becomes a sharp and less desired taste.  who cares about all the other 150 characteristics that some "advocate" sites keep track of 24/7.  the taste is #1 and this one loses that quickly. may not buy again. dropped rating due to that.

7/2018 - update - still not a big fan of these "cloudy" ales, I dont like the look.  I decided to try this again.  It is good, but nothing I would search out to buy.  It is smooth, the flavor is light.  Not a bad summer drink.  I may buy this from time to time.  I love my German beers, awesome as they have always been, but this is a nice change.

It is certainly MUCH better than all the OVER HOPPED  "craftie" crap being shoved down America's beer lovers throats by the "craftie " nazis and their version of "beer".

This is a high quality wheat beer - when I am in the mood for a more refreshing wheat beer, this is what I go to. On many occasions it is a bit to sweet and light for me, but when I am in the mood, it really hits the spot

Bottle at a wedding. Can’t believe I’ve never rated this. Hazy orange pour with a thick white head. Aroma of sweet malt, orange, coriander and slight esters.
