Bottle from my brother. Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. Aroma is wheat, fruity, light citrus, floral, boring as hell. Appearance is dark golden, light tan head, hazy. Taste is very floral, fruity, coriander, light citrus, wheat, not terrible but not great. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, floral citrus wheat and spice aftertaste. Overall, not terrible, but certainly not good.

(Draught at Bishop’s Arms Folkungagatan, Stockholm, 2 June 2017) Hazy golden amber colour with frothy, off-white head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of bread, orange and spices. Malty, fruity taste with bread, orange, coriander and citrus peel. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Low bitterness. Fairly tasty and balanced, better than expected. Quite enjoyable.
Can from beer republic. Cloudy orange color. Thin persistent white head. Medium bitterness. Medium body. Aroma and flavour is coriander, yeast, citrus, malt.

When I drink Blue Moon it is like... like liquid flowers. One of the best aroma I ever tried, very good taste, but can’t drink many of these little bottle. Something in taste stop me. Good but not in long distance.

Bottle of this on a hot summer's day. Refreshing with a slightly malty taste with a bit of spice and citrus. Okay, there are better witbiers, but not a bad effort.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Uzupełnienie profilu, archaiczna ocena sprzed czasów założenia konta na ratebeer.

Birra chiara torbida. Schiuma bianca fine e persistente. Al naso sentori di agrumi e pesca bianca. Al palato mediamente corposa con note agrumate con una lievissima acidità. Un birra discreta che si lascia bere senza pretese.
A nice thirst quenching beer after a long walk! Nice citrus/spice nose, pleasant wheat/white beer style without being too in your face. Like it!
Hazy gold color with a wheaty and orange zest aroma. Cereal like taste with a slight citrus aftertaste. Clean dry finish.
Pours hazy golden. Aroma is heavy on orange with some yeast. Taste is spicy, orange and baby syrup. Pretty decent.
Bottle from Tesco. Not a favorite. Tastes like a blend of Duvel, lager and apple juice. Don’t recommend!

330ml bottle. Pours hazy orange with small off white head. Not a huge amount in the nose but orange and a little spice. Very smooth slightly creamy mouth feel. Taste is light wheat malt, orange peel and juice, touch of corriander and white pepper. Slight bitterness on the finish. Not bad, very refreshing but not terribly exciting either.

Un liquide orange un peu trouble, peu de mousse, un nez de fraises et de fruits confits. Les fraises se retrouvent aussi en bouche, avec du bleuet, du kiwi, des clémentines, plein de fruits bien sucrés et pas grand-chose de plus. Corps mince, saveurs uniformes et grand public, c’est étonnant comment cette bière semble avoir été "dumbed down" pour les masses, comme disent les Anglo-saxons.

Aroma; wheat, lemon, catholic incense.
Look; hazy golden beer, off white head.
Taste; wheat malts, butter, lemon, caramel, clove note - mild finish.
Feel; soft soft as velvet - wow!
Overall; high drinkability, a nice one served chilled, even a bit on it’s way up. Good!
[long pint@ Bishops Arms Luleå - a safe part of Sweden]

This golden orange drink makes a substantial and fairly fine white head. There is a lively inviting look about it as it gushes with carbonation that moves quickly through the drink. 
The nose and flavour are somewhat obscure to me and I couldn't identify any particular flavours despite the promise of orange and spice. Light and frisky in the mouth the slightly sweet flavour made it an enjoyable encounter. It's not eye popping stuff but I would happily repeat and recommend it for a warm evening in the sun.

Bottle at Fifty Five Bar, Camden Town, London, UK. Colour is pale unclear yellow/orange with a medium frothy, creamy, long lasting, white head. Aroma is sweet, malts, a little bit fruity. Taste is medium sweetness, lightly bitter. Light body, soft carbonation. Very easy drinking.

Pours a cloudy amber with a fair amount of head. The drink contains lots of little bubbles rising to the surface hinting that this will be a gassy drink. Surprisingly for a beer labelled as a "wheat beer" the smell is quite lagerish but not altogether unpleasant, just generic. The texture of the drink is where this beer shines, it is soft and smooth and the overall mouth feel is quite light. The taste isn’t as complex as I would have liked but the drink does have some pleasant wheaty overtones. Overall not a bad wheat beer at all but I was expecting more.
Bue à la pression. Blonde trouble. Nez sur le grain. Palais trop sucré, ensemble mal équilibré. Inintéressante.

Bouteille 355ml. Couleur orange trouble, voile de mousse blanche. Arôme de blé, levure, orange, grains de coriandre, Orange Crush. Goût d’orange, blé, levure. Carbonatation​ moyenne, corps moyen-faible.
Dose im Flieger (Delta). Trüb, helleres Bernstein, etwas Schaun. Aroma: Getreide, säuerlich, etwas würzig. Geschmack: Getreide, Brot, Banane, leicht säuerlich, etwas sanftes.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a cloudy, golden orange with a high, tight, white head that lasts forever. Aromas of orange peel, spice, and dough. Taste is smooth and sweet with flavors of orange and spices. Light-bodied with a slick texture. Carbonation is average and the finish is sweet and long. Overall a nice beer, perfect for a hot summer day while lounging by the pool.
Cask @ The Malt House, Howden. Cloudy orange, sweet citrus nose. In the mouth it’s like a bland pale ale with a dash of orange syrup. Not repulsive but not for me.
in a bottle this is a great drink, i think a pint is too much and kills the taste and becomes sickly
Surprisingly great beer albeit from a macro brewer, floral and light with a sweet finish, great summer beer for those who enjoy a lighter less hoppy beer

bottle poured in mug. aroma is fruity, citrics and sweet; orange cloudy color with medium white head that fades away; wheat taste is easy recognizable, mild citrus touch, low bitterness, silk, dough/yeasts are present, taste aint intense, kinda watery. light bodied. very drinkable but not a fan of wits, yet, descent.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma is fruity, muddy, flour, yeast, some floral, sour, some canned apples, light tin metal. Taste is fruity, sourish, canned apples, some fruit cocktail from 70's, light bitter, some yeast. Nice beer!

Pump, Hotel Wroxham Golden orange appearance, cloudy with slight frothy head. Served with slice of orange and no great surprise it has a strong citrus orange aroma. Taste is sweet and orange juice. Very smooth finish and very refreshing. Virtually tastes like alcoholic orange juice with a twist. Far too easy to drink, extremely moorish. This American import should catch on with the younger generation.

Poured from a 35.5cl bottle. Hazy orange-brown with a few bits of sediment. Hoppy fruity aroma. No trace of Belgian yeast (pleasant supprise for me). Smooth, creamy, oily texture. Medium -full body. Light carbonation. Could be compared to an IPA with minimal carbonation and minimal bitterness.

Aroma: wrak phelons and fruity.
Appearance: hazy golden color and white head.
Taste: watery, phenols, citrus notes, dyr.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation.
Overall: drinkable and that’s all.

7/20 really disappointing, not as I remember it. Quite lagery. Remembering it being a wheat beer with orange peel. It's still ok.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at rekordling hut, southbank London. Obvious flavours of orange (well, they shoved one in). Overly sweet for wheat despite being very passable. 
Rerated in bottle in house in port Angeles WA. Didn't find it overly sweet but rather fresh. Kept score the same. Nice refresher.

Bottle. Cloudy Orange in colour. Very fruity aroma; peaches. Wheaty & Spicy. Yeasty (lots of gritty sediment). Fruity; peaches, citrus-orange. Fruity wheaty, not sweet, slight sour citrus fruity edge. Drinkable. Not bad at all. (2009-03)

bottiglia 33 cl, schiuma bianca scarsa ed evanescente, colore giallo opaco, al naso note agrumate, carbonatazione bassa, in bocca nel complesso prevale limone, lieve acidità, corpo medio basso, poco amara.
A pale (beer) orange-y in colour. Wheat (obvi), mouthfeel is dry, orange citrus, medium bodied, coriander, and possible clove. Pretty good.
Bottle. Clear amber color with ivory foam. Mild sugary, sweet malt, herbal wit spice aromas. Average mouthfeel. Sugary, tangy fruit base brew with mild clove, wit spices___not bad.
They put an orange in it? Well I guess corona and sol a lemon or lime. Guess oranges grow here...plus the beer has that flavor, well the peel anyway.. Interesting.

355ml can @ home. Pours a cloudy orange colour with a white head. Nose of orange peel and coriander. Flavour is pretty much the same... very light but present. It’s a simple brew that’s easily forgotten.
12 oz bottle. Hazy orange with modest creamy white head. Light smell of coriander and orange zest. Tastes the same, coriander and orange zest.
I usually drink this when someone else picks where we eat. Not bad not great but doable, smells of orange, nice head taste a little orange and wheat.
good beer, aroma of orange peel, light orange head, tastes fine, but nothing special.
This is like a zombie beer; it looks and smells good, but it’s dead where it counts: taste.

Enjoyed: Poured from a bottle into a weizen glass.
Appearance: Blurry orange colour; no head (looks like juice or radler).
Aroma: Citrus, pepper and something sweet. 
Palate: Similar to radlers; high carbonation.
Taste: First taste is peppery-bitter, then sweet and then again peppery-bitter. 
Overall impression: Ok, but nothing special. It doesn’t feel like having a beer. I’m not fond of this style at this moment.

Keg in the Monk. Hazy golden with a frothy white head. Little aroma. Some spice and citrus in the flavour, but this is bland. I’m not sure how this has become such a widespread product. A poor example of both a wit and especially a US craft beer.

12 ounce bottle to pint glass
sight: light amber hazy small foam
smell: wheat
taste: low bitterness sweet
feel: lively carbonation 
overall: good beer ok to repeat not to look for

355ml Bottle: Pours a cloudy amber with thin white head that disappears quickly. Aromas of orange and slight coriander. Artificial peach flavour is prominent with some spice. Slick mouthfeel with low carbonation. Bitterness is low. Overall this beer is good but is missing the orange peel flavour.
This beer tastes like the Virgin Mary’s pussy juice!!!!!! 10 out of 10 i would recommend!!!!

Tap. Cloudy golden beer with minimal white head. Aroma of oranges and tropical fruits. Sweet taste of oranges, zest and wheat. Light body, average carbonation, dry finish. Smooth. Good, unique, wheat beer, but couldn’t drink a lot of it.
Bottle shared at the folks (Tesco raid) - yellow pour with a white head. Aroma and taste is light citrus fruity, wheaty, yeasts, sugar, light floral and herbal, light spices in the close.

A citrusy flat smell with a beautiful cloudy look true to its style, this beer provides a nice refreshing taste. It’s not lasting and very thin. I did not have this beer with an orange slice as usually recomendes but still a nice taste.

From memory. Pours hazy with aroma of yeast phenols and orange. Taste is sweet, smooth with, mild spice, orange and coriander flavours. For some this tastes abit artificial, likely because the typical witbier flavours you expect are coming from added adjuncts instead of the yeast. Abit thin.
Is this just a fancy coors light? Not much flavor, might be good with a slice of orange?

APARIENCIA: de color ámbar con algunos destellos amarillos a contraluz, se observa totalmente turbia pero se alcanza a ver cierta actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color blanco de mediana retención, con burbujas compactas.

AROMA: muy cítrica, la cáscara de naranja y el coriandro destacan, algunas notas a pan del trigo, y algo dulce como vainilla.

SABOR: de inicio la acidez y ligero dulzor, seguido de las notas cítricas de la cáscara de naranja y coriandro es lo que destaca, algunas notas dulces del trigo y las maltas, pan, vainilla y algo por ahí herbal muy ligero; en el retrogusto queda un amargor ligero con cierta acidez persistente, además de algunas notas cítricas y dulces de forma tenue.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo ligero con una buena sensación sedosa en boca, mediana carbonatación.

RESUMEN: agradable, nada destacable.

On tap na "cheesecake factory" Fort Lauderdale
Cor amarelo palha quase sem brilho e turva; espuma branca de baixa formação e baixíssima persistência sem lacing.
Aroma com dulçor de laranja e especiarias.
Sabor linear seguindo o aroma; retrogosto leve com algum dulçor de laranja.
Corpo leve/medio e baixa carbonatação

Bottle at home. Hazy pale golden. Nose is sugary sweet, malts, banana, lemon, corn, a bit artificial. Tastes continues mostly sugary sweet, light spices, wheat, banana esters, light coriander, bubble gum. Too sweet and I have a feeling the sweetness comes from something it should not.

Cloudy, nearly opaque orange yellow colour with a near non existent white head. Certainly not undesirable, but also not particularly robust aroma with notes of yeast, banana, orange, and lemon. Extremely light bodied with a soft texture. Taste very much mimics the aroma and texture in that it is smooth and non intrusive consisting of orange, lemon, yeast, and banana with a slight sweet hop present during the finish. Enjoyable if one is fond of oranges.

Hazy pale straw color with storming activity. Slightly foamy white 2 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with faint legs. Flavors of roasted sweet grains, lemon, corn, wheat, faint coriander and floral spices. Sugary with low sharpness. Oily full body with prickly carbonation. Light finish, short lingering sweet malts and soft spices. Okay freshness, a bit flat. Faint flavors and bland. Not a good witbier, overall the quality is mediocre.

Pours a thin layer of foam that recedes quickly. Appears hazy straw yellow. Taste is orange, coriander, lemon, wheat. No Belgian phenolics or yeast character. Palate is thin and somewhat sweet with prickly carbonation. Overall- Drinkable, but far from a world class witbier.
Draft at the Trinity Pub in London. Clouded orange yellow color. Fruity with orange and lemon, wheat malts. Not bad.

355 ml can as Belgium Moon. Slightly clouded orange yellow, fine white lasting foam. Faint aroma of coriander, wit spices and orange. Taste is quite thin, bland and aqueous, coriander, orange and lean wheat malt. Average carbonation, light bodied, low hopped. Limp crafty industrial swill. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)

Despite its origin, I really enjoy this stuff. Pours a hazy golden with a finger of white foam that clings. Aroma is bread, bubble gum, and orange yeastiness. Flavor follows closely. Very balanced with just a bit rough in the finish.

Meta zlocista barwa jak przy pszenicznych. W aromacie pszenice I drozdze. W smaku troszke chmiel I drozdze .Piana slaby szybko znika. Nie warte polecenia moim zdanien. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Tasted from the tap several times. Cloudy, light orange colour with a medium foamy white head. Aroma of lemon, corn and wheat. Taste is light and watery with a strong presence of the wheat and a citrus finish. Next one please!
Pours a yellow orange colour with a white head. Aroma of fake orange and coriander. Tastes mild and sweet, with a bit of cardboard. Boring and bland.

12 oz. bottle, pours a cloudy golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out light coriander, some spices, and citrus. Flavour is very weak, with some skunk, light coriander, and herbal notes. Skunky and herbal. Commercial crap.

Hazy orange beer with a white head. Sweet, orange-y scent.It’s quite smooth and creamy, with the orange coming through again, a tangy, spicy aftertaste and some bitter hop. The citrusy zest really lingers, albeit in quite an understated way. Very sessionable.

Pours a cloudy golden orange color. Hazy, wheaty looking. About one finger white head, not real long lasting. Head retention low, lacing very low. But a fresh pour does look great!

Aroma is wheat, coriander, orange peel, lemongrass. Low hops, some sweetness. Smells good.

Taste is wheaty, sweet. Light orange, coriander. Buttered bread. Light in taste, but tastes good.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied. Yep, it’s pretty creamy. No bitter, a little sweet. It’s good.

Overall, it’s pretty good. Put me down for another one. Would I buy it again, yes. Would I recommend it, yes. Better than your average macro, and competitive with your best micros.

Una Belgian White Ale de color ámbar turbio y baja carbonatación. Su aroma es cítrico suave, miel y floral. Su sabor es resfrescante, durazno, naranja, cilantro y miel manteniendo su dulzor en todo momento.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso ricorda il frumento. L’intensità olfattiva è flebile e la persistenza olfattiva è corta. Il cappello di schiuma ha una discreta resistenza, con carbonazione e bollicine medie, come pure quelle del piano sottostante, spinte da una carbonazione abbondante, persistente ed insistita. L’aspetto del liquido è opalescente. Il colore è giallo torbido. Il corpo è pieno. Il dolce è medio. L’amaro è moderato. L’aspro è leggero. L’intensità gustativa è normale e la persistenza gustativa è sufficiente. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. L’aroma in bocca riporta sentori di biscotto, frumento, avena, coriandolo e fiori.

Ahhhh I remember the days of when I was introduced to something superior to Coora Light. I look at Blue Moon as the gateway to my path of totality in my craft experiences. It was awesome then but has lost its luster now. In the glass the appearance is cloudy, light orange with a thin, short lived white head of foam. The aroma is orange peel and coriander with some cereal in the background. The taste prevails flavors of wheat, tart orange, and some spice, mostly coriander through and through. A middle of the road brew. Still great memories held as a first-timer for me.

Pours a very hazy golden with a medium white rim on top that doesn’t leave much lacing. Nose is of citrus and lightly sweet cereals but pretty light on the coriander and citrus, though. Taste is lightly sweet with some bready and floury cereals with a good dose of citrus this time. Body is medium and carbonation moderately high and a little pricky. This abrasive carbonation does dry the palate pretty effectively, though, and prevents it from ever feeling cloying. A pretty good macro wit.

[backlog] 11-04-15 / bottle at TGI Fridays Melbourne. Cant stand a belgian wit. To light. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 3/5

Wheat, orange, light Belgium yeast flavor. Decent option if no craft beer available. Better if served with an orange slice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

De la macro cervecera Coors(U.S.A) esta muy conocida Belgian White o Witbier de 5.4% ABV.
En apariencia es una cerveza con una corona de espuma delgada con poca retención y de perlas pequeñas, el color es pajizo con turbiedad, su cuerpo se nota ligero en el cristal.
El aroma es baja con enfoque hacia la malta, se puede apreciar trigo, ligero dulzor, nota cítrica, cascara de naranja.
El sabor de igual forma es hacia las maltas, se aprecia bizcocho, dulzor de grano, notas cítricas como a naranja, al final tiene cierta acidez residual, una cerveza regular con poco carácter e identidad y esto permite que sea bastante tomable.
citrus, cloudy, hazy, lightly sour, lightly bitter, light sweetness, light body,

Looks like hazy apple juice with a little white head. Aroma is oatmeal and orange. Taste is fresh sourness but with a grainy sweetness and a dusty character in the finish. Rather undercarbonated, not very good.
Branded Belgian Moon in Canada. Kind of looks like pee smells a bit fruity and tastes a bit of orange, a lively carbonation, pretty bland wheat flavour overall.

Appearance Pours hazy yellow, with a small flat head. 

Aroma Yeast, barnyard, white bread, orange juice. 

Taste Biter, slightly dry, sour finish. 

Palate Slick feel, low carbonation.

Aroma: Orange, citrus, alcohol
Appareance: orange, hazy, minimal head, white foam dissapears quickly
Taste; lightly sour, lightly bitter, orange
Palate: medium body, lively, bitter finish

I was apprehensive about this seeing that it was recommended to be served with an orange slice, which seemed like a way of playing down an essentially inferior tasting beer. Wanted to give it a go though, and find out what their interpretation of a Belgian wheat beer was like. This beer pours an aesthetically beautiful cloudy orange beer with a smooth white head. Unfortunately that’s the best thing about it and the drinking experience is all downhill. Aroma is zesty, and the head tastes of orange peel but synthetic. First taste was rather unpleasant and a bit strange, but when I proceeded to drink the flavour seems to become better with acquaintance. Not much going on with the palate, there’s some orange peel flavour and it’s quite yeast-y. The beer is unfiltered but not much sediment was present. It’s fairly dry and not as smooth as purported on the label, otherwise it’s alright and not too watery. Finish is an an astringent artificial zest. Approaching the bottom of the glass it was enjoyable but at a lacklustre level, so I’d say that it was tolerable. Pretty unimpressive beer, it’s probably one of those that I’d session drink without thinking too much about it. It does have a nice label though so the aesthetic is probably the peak of pleasure in regards to this beer

Pours very hazy pale gold with a white head that leaves some spotty lacing.  Aroma is a muted coriander and wheat.  Taste is orange and wheat. Smooth mouthful with low carbination. A good simple beer.
Bottle, 0.35l. Hazy yellow colour with decent sized white head. Lively carbonation. Citrus and wheat aroma. Taste of orange, wheat and some herbs. Moderate bitter aftertaste. Overall decent brew.

This was my first Belgian White and the second type of beer that I drank at a recent wedding. It’s relatively light but has good taste and is smooth. It was easy to drink and enjoyable but not a style that I would add to my favorites.
Not much you can say about blue moon that hasn’t already been said. It’s a lovely drink. Nothing complex. Just a wee fizz, light head. Nice with a slice of orange for a double citrus buzz.
Good white beer pleasant taste average appareance a good daily beer after a hard work day

Draft @ mista A: coriander, wheat App: hazy pale thick white head. T/p: med body with light acidic finish. Moderate high carbonation. O: average wheat a bit generic nothing hurtful. Sadly can’t recall how the can version I had 6 years ago compare to this Canadian replica

Nouveauté sur nos tablettes au Québec, cette bière nommé Bleu moon aux États-Unis est présentée ici sous l’appellation Belgian Moon. J’ignore pourquoi. La bière est d’une couleur dorée, la mousse est généreuse. Nez de levures typiques, d’orange et de coriandre. En bouche, le blé amène des notes sucrées. Les levures sont bonnes, l’orange subtile. Résultat : une bière d’été rafraichissante, qui descend trop bien. Ma foi, je crois que le pari est réussi car elle semble goûter pas mal la même chose que celle de nos voisin américains que j’ai bue à plus d’une reprise. Bonne bière de soif! Cheers!

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, best before 7/11/2016. Pours very hazy/cloudy golden orange color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense white head with decent retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Good appearance. Aromas of lemon, orange peel, pear, apple, coriander, clove, light banana/bubblegum, wheat, biscuit, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Nice and pleasant around with good balance and complexity of fruity/earthy yeast, spices, and bready malt notes; with solid strength. Taste of lemon, orange peel, pear, apple, coriander, clove, light banana/bubblegum, wheat, biscuit, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Minimal herbal/spice bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, orange, pear, apple, coriander, wheat, biscuit, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/earthy yeast, spices, and bready malt flavors; with a good malt/spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth and moderately creamy/bready mouthfeel that is nice. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5.4%. Overall this is a good witbier. All around good complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/earthy yeast, spices, and bready malt flavors; very smooth and refreshing to drink. A nicely enjoyable offering.
Sinceramente pensavo proprio che fosse meglio, ma devo ammettere che è molto anonima e dimenticabile...

I am a bit surprised about the low ratings for this beer - in my opinion it is a superb wit beer. The taste of oranges and coriander define this beer, and the taste lingers for quite some time. It is very refreshing and ideal for a summer evening. It also looks nice and is a bit sweet. Try it!

12oz bottle - Pours a cloudy pale yellow with white head that fades quickly. Fruity aroma, lemon, banana, cloves; Floral and doughy. Flavors of the same; mildly bitter. Belgian yeast detectable. A bit thin.

October 2020. 500ml can. Czech-brewed version. Pours hazy gold with a tall white head. Aroma is coriander, citrus, floral. Taste is medium sweet, coriander, wheat, orange peels. Light bitter finish. Still don’t really like it. Too many spices. 6/4/5/3/11 = 2.9.


June 2016. UK-brewed version.Pint on tap at The Bridge Inn near Salisbury. Pours hazy yellow with a small bright white head. Aroma is coriander, orange peels, soap. Taste is citrus, grain, wheat. An average wit. 7/3/5/2/10 = 2.7.

On tap. Pours a cloudy golden sediment filled with white head and no lacing. Smells of citrus. Taste is light and refreshing citrus. Little bitterness and light aftertaste makes this a decent hot weather, quench your thirst beer.
Hard to believe I haven’t rated this yet. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a pale head. Aromas of orange, light banana, sweet yeast. Taste is sweet but bland for the style. Higher carbonation.

The appearance is that of a belgian wit, maybe a bit more orange that the classic yellow of a Hoegaarden to name one, but aroma and taste are much weaker.

Nice refreshing beer, but nothing else.

Pours dark orange like color, haze, with one finfer white foamy head. Visually moderate high carbonation. Aroma: lemon, oeange peel, hint of banana. Flavor: typical wheat malt flavor, with banana like esters and hint of orange peels. Body is moderate mediun, carbonation is medium to high, texture is soft

Hazy gold with big head that fades down fairly fast. Smell is wheat and coriander but the taste is mostly grains with just a mild hint at the spices. Decent and easy drinking brew but not something I will go out of my way to get.
Ingrédients et nez d’une bière blanche, mais c’est une bière ambrée qu’on retrouve dans le verre. Aspect mis à part, la bière est agréable, mais on est loin d’un blanche
Bottle to cup. Wheat and orange blossom aroma. Cloudy burnt orange, no head. Grapefruit pith, weak orange, tap water, bitter wheat finish. An easy drinking beer yet underwhelming in flavor.

Versa nel bicchiere di colore oro opaco, con torbidità data dai lieviti in sospensione; la schiuma è piuttosto modesta, bianca e di breve durata. All’aroma in evidenza sentori agrumati, con note di lievito, alcuni esteri fruttati che portano alla memoria il melone; ma carattere di basso livello. In bocca un primo impatto di grano, seguito da sapori agrumati. Il corpo risulta molto leggero, con alta carbonazione ed una freschezza che si avvicina a quella di una Lager. Il sapore di malto è mite, con una dolcezza moderata; leggera acidità a metà bevuta, finale secco con una leggera astringenza.
Une blanche à la robe ambrée, au nez fruité et épicé et à la bouche ronde et fruitée qui évoque plus une wheat ale qu’une wit bier.

Dec. ’15. A 0.355 l bottle from a local Tommy supermarket. It poured a hazy orange body with a small head atop. Some weak, but notable medicinal/plastic chlorophenol over slight coriander note in aroma. Flavor was quite pleasant, without off-notes, moderately sweet, but that candy/sugary sweetness seemed too pushy for getting more body from a simple brew. Otherwise yeasty with a touch of coriander. Moderately long, sweet finish. Okay, drinkable and even enjoyable to a degree, but this is something else than a Wit.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 24A). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: moderate wheat aroma with slight sweet and honey-like grain aroma. very faint coriander note. APPEARANCE: pale gold color and hazy. medium moussy white head with medium retention. TASTE: moderate grainy sweet flavor with a honey-like character. slight oat nuttiness. extremely faint coriander and orange ntoes. low bitterness with a semi-sweet finish. PALATE: medium body with medium carbonation. slight creaminess but with a pulverulent texture. OVERALL: a Witbier with the main characteristics very faint and with a pulverulent texture.

The beer looks nice. The looks are typical for a witbier. The color is a light orange. The beer is very cloudy, caused by the unfiltered aspect. It has a nice look, almost satin like. Its the appearance a witbier should have. On top of the beer a nice layer of white soft foam is formed. The bulk of the foam collapses rather quickly, to leave a thin drape behind. The smell of the beer is nice. It’s not wolds best witbier smell though. It could use a bit more complexity. I smell some coriander and sweet orange. There is also a nice zesty bitterness. I also smell alcohol and some doughy yeasts. The balance is nice, although I believe there is missing something. I wished the lovely fruity sweetness was a bit stronger. The taste of the beer is nice. There is a lovely bitter zesty flavor. I also taste coriander, orange, yeasts and alcohol. Its the same as the smell, but a bit stronger. It’s easy drinkable and must be lovely to drink on a terrace in the summer.
Cloudy amber gold color with with little to no head. Taste is fruity almost like blueberries. Overall an ok beer I would drink it again.

hazy golden colour, some off-white head, which disappears quickly; aroma of coriander, bread, floral and fruity notes; taste is quite sweet with fruitiness, hints of honey and coriander as well as bitter orange notes; not among the best witbiers, but refreshing

Pours hazy orange, almost like orange juice texture. It has pretty thick texture, and looks cloudy and heavy. White head dissipates right away. Really low on flavor, barely can taste any hops and bit of orange peel. Pretty bland, and no carbonation to speak of but drinkable.
Cloudy Amber gold little rimmimg white head; aroma is mild if any; flava is grainy wheaty some yeasty notes; feels medium chewy and zingy; finishes dry tangy grainy
Good white beer pleasant taste average appareance a good daily beer after a hard work day
Aroma muito suave, cor amarelo clara, com espuma leve. Bem encorpada, sabor citrico e mel.
Both bottles and cans; this is a fairly popular brew down here in Alabama - it has a nice, citrusy tone with a pleasant aftertaste; generally, you can’t go wrong with this easy-drinking beer.
Draught @ BB King Blues. A really bad example of a belgian witbier. Thin in taste aswell as mouthfeel. Refreshing anyway.

Tap @Kongs of King Street.
Served with a slice of orange.
Strong orange colour, hazy, small creamy head. Aroma of citrus, grass and herbs. Good refreshing taste, light body, quite sparkling.

Bottle from Saisbury’s. Have had this a few times before, but never ticked it. A clouded dull orange coloured pour with a dull beige cap. Aroma is decent zesty orange, doughy wheat, wit yeast, spritzy. Flavour is composed of slight dull wheaty grains, dough, bready, orange rind, hints of orange zest. Palate is slightly abrasive, high carboantion, slightly chalky. ok for a wit.

Wow.. as a Hoegaarden lover I thought I’d give this one a try. Nothing like what I expected. Aroma is of UK Golding hops which I hate in any ale, spice palate is totally masked by hops. A sickly beer. Yuk!
355ml bottle at the Frog and Fiddle. Pours hazy yellow with little head. Aroma is wheat and yeast, quite funky. Taste is more gentle, wheaty, a little bitter.

Started the fruit beer craze with this brand a few years ago...good taste but a little bitey compared to 312...so many other crafts now but Blue Moon and Coors Light is always a good choice 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Damn I wish I had seen the Coors on the can before I paid.
I love wheat beers usually they are quite tasty and special, this is not much of either.
First off wheats usually pour with a fluffy head, this went plat as pee on a plate ASAP
Smells OK a bit weak, looks OK 
Taste , hmm not much
Pretty underwhelming , now what do I do with the other can. 
On the upside it is way better the the usual stuff the try and pass off as beer.

355ml bottle bought at Q Club in SoHo, Central. 



Cloudy, hazy straw orange colour with a layer of yeast sedimentsOne finger head with off-white foam which lasts for 2 minutes; Good sticky lacing with fizzy carbonation; Quite fragrant aroma of light malt, with moderate wheat, light tartness, light coriander, light orange peels, sugar, bread and muddy yeast; Mid to light sweet taste of light malt, with strong wheat, light tartness, orange notes, ligth coriander, strong carbo, molasses, spices, biscuits, strong yeast, very light lemon, very low bitter hops and thin grass; Mid to light body. Slick palate; Mouth Feel is light maltyness in a thick, slightly soapy background. Wheaty but not really tart. Touches of oranges and coriander, strongly carboed with soda feel. Fairly sweet with moderate spices. Cheap muddy yeast like those from Rogue Ales. Iffy… Hoppiness is no aroma. Spices, very light lemon and thin grass in taste; Bitterness is very low for an abrupt, very low astringent wheaty finish; Fairly dry after taste. Light orangey and very low bitter to mouth.



Comments: This one has fair amounts of orange and coriander, but the wheatyness isn’t assertive, and it suffers from slightly soapy taste and poor yeast. Good idea ruined by sub-par ingredients. Not recommended.

Blue Moon Belgian White is just not that inspiring to me. It’s a very heavy body for a wheat beer, I feel very full from drinking one. Even with an orange garnish, it lacks the flavor that you’re looking for from something that calls itself craft. That being said, it’s not really a bad beer. I can drink it, it has a pleasant taste, I have good memories with it, the finish with an orange is kinda nice. It’s just not great. I think 3/5 is about right. Maybe a touch high, but its what I have for now.
Wheat ale has a smooth start. Follows with a slightly bitter swallow. The aroma and finish are clean with a little snap.

Aroma is something sour and citrus. Hazy yellow liquid with minimal head.
Taste includes some citrus notes, light sweet and little bit bitter. Overall a good refreshing beer.
12-ounce bottles poured into a weizen glass. Beautiful cloudy unfiltered look, tall head, typical wheat beer flavor. Not bitter at all.

Nice refreshing wit.
Unclear golden color with a fine white head. Ok intensity in the aroma. Medium body and an ok carbonation. Mellow sweetness. Fruity, some yeast, citric and some spices.
[Bottle from Systembolaget web order in Sweden]

Apple cider-like, golden and cloudy color. Aroma of citruses, citrus peel, herbs (coriander) and maybe a dash of lemongrass and yeast. Soft carbonisation. Very drinkable beer, although its aroma quickly vanishes - smooth finish, as it says. Refreshing witbier, I must say
Grumlig, aprikosfärgad, litet skum. Doftar svagt av honung. Smaken fyllig maltsötma. Eftersmaken hyggligt lång och söt. Långtifrån belgare, men OK.

BB 10.09.16. Poured a clouded yellow straw colour with a white collar that didn’t lace. Carbonation high with medium sized bubbles that gave a soft mouthfeel. Aroma subtly of coriander/spice along with sweet citrus. Taste of sweet orange with very subtle spice/cloves and a slight bitterness. Light body. Soft with an orange sweetness and light bitterness on the finish. Not up to the standards of a Belgian wheat beer. Disappointed as was expecting better.

It pours cloudy copper with golden highlights; the head is off white and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: banana, orange zest, and pepper. The taste is light bitter; the aforementioned aroma notes carry through. The palate is medium light bodied with medium carbonation and a medium short finish. Overall, it’s a great when there’s nothing else on tap.
Citrus lemony smell. Pale color, light head. Mild taste, short on tongue. Ok, Belgian wit.

Aroma citrus-like. Appearance golden, clear, white foam. Long lasting bubbles. I liked the taste with some gentle spices. 

Bottle.

Light amber, hazy, fizzy with lots of bubbles, pillowy foam. Aroma honey, soap, orange peel. Mouthfeel medium, high carbonation. Taste sourish, some citrus fruit and cloves with coriander in finish. Finish dry, something unpleasant creeps in there - basement aromas and musk. Not overly keen of this one although I anticipated worse

Pours a hazy gold with very fast dissipating head. Aroma is of coors lights almost with some slight citrus and spice added, and a little musty. Taste almost the same, a macro lager with a squeeze of orange juice. Has a medium light body with high carbonation, making it slightly refreshing. I would drink this at a bbq, but would never buy it myself.

A hazed golden wit with a thin white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with light corn adjunct notes, faint bananas, faint cloves, so-so. In mouth, a sweet fruity malt with light banana, light cloves, light mineral notes, memory of a wit. Bottle at United Lounge ORD.

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured slightly hazy, golden, with a nice white head and some spotty lacing. Aroma of yeast and spices, and some malts. Taste is some spices (coriander and orange peel), some malts, slightly hoppy. Honestly not bad, easy to drink.
Tap to pint. Pours clouded yellow-orange, white head. Aroma of orange gummy candy and coriander. Taste of orange peel, spice and wheat mash. Standard American style wit.
Orange peel, coriander, Hazy golden. 16oz can. Might benefit from an orange slice.

I freaking love this beer it is my favorite go too Beer for special Occasions. They need to make in all types of packaging like 18Pk and 16 Once 6pks! A little pricey and would be my everyday beer if it was more affordable!
Bottle in England. Aroma is light malt, wheaty, some yeast, bready, light sweetish fruits, citrus, hint of yeast. Flavour is light to moderate sweet. Body is about medium. Not a bad Witbier at all.
Well it's just most American beer I have heard of ;) I don't like Belgian style but you must admit it this beer has something in it :) i always recommend this beer for first timers in USA and women
citrus, smoke, pale, cloudy, minimal head, tan foam, medium bitterness, light body, soft carbonation, little pricey
citrus, dough, pale, cloudy, minimal head, light sweetness, medium body, creamy, average carbonation,abrupt,

This is a Belgian style wheat beer brewed in Canada. Sounds interesting, true. Problem is that Belgians make really great beers and this task was obviously too much to handle for our Canadian friends.

Falls short in every aspect, except the price. Price is competitive to Belgian beers. Ugh. At least something, right?

Right... Anyway, let’s leave the Belgian style to Belgians.

Bottle, Ale House Chelmsford, thanks to James. 

Really no notes of a Belgian wit ale at all. Some slight coriander but all the elements of macro brewing. I’m sure at one point this beer was good but now it’s not.
Citrus, floral, clove. Creamy mouthfeel with a moderate amount of carbonation. Pleasant

355ml can as "Belgian Moon". Cloudy yellow, white head which dies fast. Nose has orange peels. Taste - orange peel, wheat, yeast. A little orange peel at the end and pretty dry. Light body. Overall, about what I expected - a drinkable but unexciting wit.
Hazy amber/gold color; Light to medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat, & citrus; Flavor of wheat, citrus, coriander, and some bananas; Decent for a macro brew.

Bottiglia da 0,33. Schiuma corposa e persistente. Colore oro opaco. Carbonatura abbondante. Aroma deciso e vagamente acidulo. Gusto erbaceo con sentori di fieno ed agrumi. Finale lungo ed aspro. Consiglio 6/10

When it is all said and done this is a pretty solid wheat beer. It has great color and taste it does lack in the aroma thou. Overall the combination of mild hops and the spice has a nice balance. I would recommend it to anyone
Cerveza muy fresca, con poco gas. Es de trigo pero tiene muy poco sabor, tiene mejor aroma de lo que muestra después.

Aroma of citrus, light spice, and some sweet fruit. Appearance is clear with a white head. The head is pretty but the beer itself is not. Taste has a good amount of orange peel/orange flavor. Light bitter finish.

It might not be an excellent beer but it’s serviceable and way better than most of the stuff you find in your average pub in NYC.

Re-edited whoops.

Bottiglia. Colore giallo torbido, poca schiuma bianca di breve persistenza. Aroma citrico e lieviti in prevalenza. Gusto equilibrato che non esaspera il dolce, tantomeno l’amaro, dove riemergono le note citriche; si evince anche la nota speziata. Carbonatazione medio / bassa, birra fresca e godibile anche se per nulla particolare o da ricordare, ma dissetante.

Bottle. Clear citrus aroma. Some yeast. Decent. Tastewise pretty interesting quencher. Good yeastiness, some banana, citrus and a bit of a spicy bite. Pretty good beer for a Miami afternoon. Love to have one during a Dutch summer day as well. Fair carbonation, thickish texture. Not that overly special, but certainly well-brewed.
Another awesome wheat beer, my second favourite next to Tuatara Hefe, easy to drink, awesome flavours, not too bitter, not sweet, must be had with an orange in the glass.
Nasty musty are ma. Hefe looking lean no flavor some dirty yeast. No good brew.

12 oz bottle leftover from an Extra Life marathon party last month. Cloudy orange with half a finger of off-white head. Aromas of lemon lime and orange citrus, herbs, a little yeast. Tastes of orange citrus, herbs, a little citrus peel, some wheat. Light body with a semi-dry finish. Decent wit.

Cloudy golden yellow with a frothy white head. Aromas of wheat, orange peel and lots of coriander develop. Tangy, soft and rather light bodied. Brisk sweetness with some spice notes and dominant yeasty esters. Medium finish. Ok.

Robe blonde cuivré avec un léger trouble.
Au nez des note de malt et d'épices.
En bouche c'est rond mais pas écœurant, le côté épicé et fruité relève le crémeux de cette blanche.

Sympa mais sans plus.

Interesting unfiltered/hazy brown/orange vomit color with very weak white foam and visable carbonation like on a soft drink. Aromas of soap and shampoo? Maybe bit fruity and citrusy, very strange and unusualy aroma? Palate, light/medium body, thin and watery texture with minimal hints of the yesty feeling on the tongue. And has no finish? Taste, light, bit somewhat maybe sourish but lightly? has hints of them vitamin C tablets that you put in water? Overall, not the bet Witbier I have tired and certanly not best I have rated, very strange aromas and taste wount say it is good beer...
Rated from old notes, 2012. Bottle. Cloudy amber color, white head. Sweet flavor with cloves, hint of lemon. Yeasty finishin. Medium body, medium-light carbonation. Not great for the style.
Bottle. Pours light golden, cloudy, small head. Light aroma of yeast, a hint of banana and some other stuff. Taste of orange peel, yeast, banana, wheat.
Kupljeno u konzuma ..hvala vedrane...pivo loše kvalitete i slatkastog okusa..morali smo ga probati...ništa posebno
Every time I see the commercial for this beer where they bill it as a legitimate Belgian brew, I want to jump into the fermentation tank and drown myself.
I’m not a fan of this beer. I thought it had a shampoo type nose to it. The flavor was citrus, with a lot of carbonation. It really tasted like medicine
I may choose to pay the premium price for it every once in awhile. overall I like this beer, it just lacks the ability to make me a fan like I am of other brews.
Not really living up to the wonders from Belgium, but on a hot summers day it definitely does its work.
Bottle 330 ml. Little dull in taste and watery body, but overall pretty allright for a witbier.

Beer from bottle in local pub. No glass. I was hoping this would be comparable to Hoegaarden (which I had been told it was) and I was sooo wrong. OK beer, but the flavour mix with orange and coriander just doesn’t work as well. Can’t tell you why - just doesn’t. I have been back to pub many times and just can’t take the plunge to order this again (about $9 a bottle here). I actually order a local macro beer on tap - enough said.
12 fl oz Flasche. Naturtrüb und orangefarben. Kleine Schaumkrone. Weizenaroma. Mild-süss.

On tap served in a pint glass.

Appearance: hazy amber with a very durable white head that leaves decent lacing. 

Aroma: average or better for style. This arrived with an orange clice on the glass, so the citrus coponent may be artificially raised 

Flavor: mild and tame even for style. Refreshing and lightly fruity. 

O: easy drinking with no significant flaws excepting mediocre aroma and the quantity of flavor.

0.33 l bottle at Europa Cinema, Zagreb, Croatia. Pours cloudy orange to dark golden with a small off white head. Grain aroma along with some citrus, fruit candy, orange. Sweet, but empty. Aroma is present but seems fake. Medium carbonation, light to medium body. Some banana in the finish, fruits again. Fades quickly.

On tap @ San Jose - CA. Color: hazy pale blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam... And, and a slice of lemon?!? Smell: fruity and lemon (for sure from the slice), wheat and sweet sugar. Yeast notes. Taste: good sweet taste, too sweet maybe. Wheta notes. Lemon finish (from the slice sure). Aftertaste: sweet fruity lemon and wheat.

Bottle 0.33l form Konzum supermarket in Pula, Cro. Cloudy dark yellow color, small head. Very carbonated, medium body. Nice flowery aroma. Taste is ok, unbalanced sweetness and too carbonated. Could taste something like vodka in it. Vodka and cheapness in aftertaste.
Yellow to orange color, medium white head. Very nice aroma od orange, coriander, yeast, wheat, citrus. Taste citrus, coriander and orange, light to medium body. Soar aftertaste.

On tap at the Air Canada Centre (as Belgian Moon). Pours a cloudy dull golden colour with large white head. Aroma is artificial, sweet fruitiness, light spiciness and a bit of wheat. Flavour ditto with lots of sweet, artificial fruit character. Fizzy carbonation. Meh.

Slightly hazy golden straw with a fizzy off white head that disappears quickly.
Smell: Fruity, light citrus, a hint of spice, and malt sweetness.
Fruity, apple, light citrus, coriander spice, a little corn, and malt sweetness.
Light body, moderate carbonation. Pretty drinkable.
A very respectable white beer, light golden, white head, slightly aromatic, not as much flavor as i prefer, but not bad. Goes down smooth and is easy to drink.

Pours a hazy straw color with a white head. Aromas of citrus fruits and lemon grass. This is one of the first craft beers I tried. Nice orange Flavors. Not bad. If it was brewed by some obscure brewery it would have higher ratings. Light on the palate. Nice lacing in the glass. Overall nice refreshing ale.

Bottle from Coop. Let’s see how the macros do at making craft... Not so well, apparently. At least this Wit is rather boring. It’s brewed to the style, but there’s absolutely nothing interesting about it. Meh.
Bottle at home, hazy yellow/orange beer, small head, aroma is spices, Taste is spices, some citrus, average white beer.
Cloudy yellow color, small white head. Mild wit aroma, spices and all that, but too modest. Taste is same plus yeast. Thin body, lively carbonation, dry finish. Not that bad. //konzum
Fat på river dock café staten island new york. Rejält disig gul kulör. Doft av koriander och äpple. Ganska gräddig smak med äpplekart och lite dill

Average in every aspect. Pours a white color with a little bit golden in it, not a typical belgian white apperance. The aroma is strong in spice, weak in orange. Tastes refreshing, with caramel sweet and almost zero bitterness.

35.5 cl bottle from Roto dinamic, served in a snifter. Murky orange to tan, with minimal white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is malty, grainy, with soapy touches, orange, faint coriander. Light to medium body, low carbonation. Taste is low to medium sweet with low bitterness. Texture is oily to creamy.
It great for a quick pick up from tesco but there are many other beers I?d take over it. The slight spice it has keeps bringing me back to it.
Ok for a macro I guess. Spice notes but also dirty rag. Taste spicy but dirty rag still is there. The dirty rag killed it.
Fruity notes and coriander make a good combination for my taste. Nice to drink, refreshing, dark orange color.

Hazy yellow colored, small white head. Aroma is honey, caramel, bit of wheat and some spices. Taste is medium sweet wheat, honey, caramel, spice and only light orange, some veggie soup notes in the otherwise yeasty finish. Light to medium bodied, soft carbonation.
Hell herber, mild fruchtiger Antrunk. Spritzig hefig, trocken nach Koriander, süffig, erfrischend. 9/8/10/9/7/8
Ciekawe piwo z delikatna nuta cytrusow . Metne z delikatnym osadem ,piana biala nie za duza. Bardzo wyczuwalna kukurydza.ogolnie dobre

Accessible white ale with bready malts combined with fresh Belgian yeast.
Light coriander sharp spice notes in otherwise low bitterness. Hazy appearance. 12 oz bottle
355ml bottle from Tesco. Cloudy orange colour with a small quickly fading head. Orange and coriander in both the aroma and taste. It’s a nice one but I’d rather have an actual Belgian Witbier.

When friends make you go to a Zagrebačka-run pub, get new rates you’ve been procrastinating to get for some time now. Or something. At the Ožujsko Pub in Tkalča, Zagreb. Made in Canada. Murky amber body with a white head. Aroma of coriander, slightly sweet. Candyish coriander taste, notes of caramel. That’s pretty much it. A simple, effective quasi-wit that might appeal to a less demanding audience. But with Hoegaarden around, I’m not getting it again.
Cloudy light orange color with small fast fading head. Aroma of tangerine and coriander. Taste is sweet with medium and chunky body.
0.355l bottle. Cloudy yellow color with fast fading white head. Aroma of dough, orange and coriander. Taste is sweet, sour and little bitter.

Een poging om Hoegaarden na te maken. Degelijk niet gelukt, fletse smaak en niet te drinken.
Cloudy yellow big white head and loads of carbon dioxide. Very wheat like and some orange peel. Very watery and some metallic edge to it. Cheap.
Alaranjada com pouca formação de espuma. Notas cítricas de laranja com pouco coentro. Corpo super leve, muito refrescante e quase nenhum amargor

Bottle. Small-medium white head. Hazy. Aroma of wheat, yeast, some coriander and spices. In taste wheat and spiciness. Missing citrus and coriander character. Some kind of sour finish. Lightly body. Overall: wheat beer without wit character (citrus fruits and coriander). Really boring wit.

Pours hazy dark yellow with a moderate, fast diminishing white head. Wheat, dusty aroma with notes of coriander and lemon. Flavor is sweet, quite dry with notes of wheat, coriander, soap (probably from the coriander). Decent.

Hazy light orange color, average sized white head. Malty and spicy aroma. Taste of malt, coriander and orange juice. Light to medium body, very high carbonation. Overcarbonated but drinkable.

Aroma full of citrus. Taste full of citrus smooth but crisp. Refreshing. Great for the go to beer

La mousse disparaît subitement. Le liquide est blond voilé, pas très beau. Un nez de soufre et de pelures d’orange avec des élans vinaigrés et acidulés. C’est mieux au fil des gorgées . On goûte le blé et les agrumes et par moment c’est poivré. Même si ça ressemble à un brassin amateur, c’est buvable. Merci à mon frère. (1584-140915)

Bottled 355ml. -at Pivana Zagreb. Hazy orange coloured, small white head, coriander in the nose. Quite wheaty, sweetish fruity, light yeasty and plenty of coriander with touch of vegetables (celery for sure) and mild spicy finish. Not bad but a bit messy brew.
Blue Moon is a very drinkable Belgian style wheat ale. It has good flavor not bitter or hoppy.
Not a strong aroma. Typical Belgian white but not a strong wheat flavor. Almost no citrus taste.
Its a fruity beer but its too sweet and that bitterness is too low its more like fruity wheat soda
nice cloudy orange colour, thick bubbly head. orangey aroma, light bodied. An interesting beer altogether, very refreshing.
Draft to plastic cup. I guess It’s free. Thanks VMWare. Apple, wheat, a touch of yeast. Clear light amber. Taste is skunk and pepper. No thanks.
Australian coca cola version in bottle. Thick syrupy opaque orange with little head, no head. Over the top artificial orange aroma, unpleasant vitamin c aftertaste. Not good
Pours with cloudy orange color and yeast particles. Very dissappointing head, quickly fading. Orange and citrus aroma obviously. with fizzy carbonation it looks like fanta tastes like fanta actually.

Bottle sample. Hazy yellow with small white head. The aroma has lots of orange, yeasty with notes of wheat and candy. Sweet flavor, fruity (orange) and yeasty, notes of wheat and black pepper, a bit watery. Very carbonated, medium-bodied.

Pours hazy orange/amber with a large, quickly fading head.
Nose shows doughy wheat, orange peel, coriander, heavy floral and herbal notes.
Flavours are quite sweet and include massive orange peel notes.

Robe orangée. Mousse moyennement.
Blé marqué, fruits jaunes et agrumes.
Moyennement longue en bouche.
Une blanche passable.
On tap at the Frog Pond, in Rochester, NY. Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma is orange. Taste is orange, wheat. Found it refreshing.

Bottle - Cloudy orangey yellow colour with thick foamy head. Strong orange aroma. Smooth in mouth with slight ting on tongue. Good orange taste but not particularly tasting. Ok wit beer - easy drinkable.
Don’t really understand why it’s best served with a piece of orange. Bit odd. Tastes better on tap.

Apariencia: Color naranja turbio sin efervecencias visibles. Cabeza minima blanca de muy corta duración. Para anunciarse conmo una Ale Blanca, esperaba un liquido más claro. 3/5
Aroma:un poco de caramelo, pan y quizas goma de mascar. Muy tenues los aromas. 6/10
Paladar: Cuerpo mediano de textura cremosa y pegajosa en las encías. Sin burbujas y con un final largo astringente. 4/5
Sabor: un potente sabor dalado con un final bastante dulce. Prácticamente esta ausente alguna nota amarga. Interesante. 10/10
Overall. Disfruté mucho de esta cerveza. A la fecha la más dulce que me ha tocado probar. Solo por eso merece ser tomada en cuenta por el aficionado catador. Tengo debilidad además, por los tragos dulces. Lástima que su apariencia le hizo perder puntos. 19/20

Fruity aroma in a cloudy honey pour. Would have to be a benchmark of the American take on the Belgian wheat style. A tart start and full body makes this a very refreshing brew (albeit not what some beer afficianados would call ’craft’).
Pours a hazy orange color with white head. Flavors of orange and coriander. Put a slice of orange in!

March 10, 2021
On tap, 500ml. Pours cloudy orange-yellow with tall thick and stable head, very creamy. Carbonation is medium to gentle with a wheaty slightly thick body, a bit sticky texture not great. Tastes mildly sweet with some gentle acidity and very low if present bitterness. Flavors of wheat, esters, grain, yeast, over ripe banana, mild clove, very mild orange, citrus acidity. It's really OK, and quite drinkable, the spice and fermentation flavors are present but gentle. It shows quite a few of the qualities I dislike in wheat beers - an overly sticky-starchy texture, over prominent wheat malt flavor, and unbalanced esters.
3/4/4/2/9=2.2

Aug 13, 2015
6/3/6/3/15=3
Bottle sample at Beers 2015. Hazy yellow color. Smell - fruity, yeasty, a bit soapy. Taste - fruity, coriander, citrusy, a bit mild and watery. Light-bodied and fizzy.
Poured from bottle cloudy orange with one finger head. Aromas of spice citrus and grain. Taste is sweet with a nice lemon finish.
From bottle. Coriander, Sweet wheat, Belgian spice and light citrus. Sweet, some acidity, coriander and Belgian spice finish. Overall: On the sweet side of things.

Cloudy orange. Light / medium body and well carbonated. Not exactly subtle - it’s like a vat of ground coriander has been poured into the brew. An OK version of the style and it’s quite drinkable, but there are better.
12 oz. bottle. I really like this beer, great aroma and appearance. A good tasting unfiltered wheat beer.

[7335-20150704] Tap. Light orange grains aroma. Hazy, orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Bitter orange grains flavour has a nice sweet finish. Medium body. Good, great for a sunny ballgame. (7/3/7/3/13) 3.3
