Light golden color, distinct orange scent and taste.  I’m not a huge fan of Belgian Whites, but this is a nice accesible beer to have around.

Tap-First time I’ve had this beer on tap. Pours cloudy orange w/a large foamy light brown head which lasts a while. Definite citrus/floral aroma. Somewhat sweet, fruity, citrus taste which is hard to describe, like orange but not exactly. Long fizzy, creamy finish. Draft version much better than bottle.  Refreshing change of pace beer, but I wouldn’t drink it all the time.
Pours a cloudy yellow.  Aromas of orange and spice.  Flavor has too much orange, I didn’t care for this beer at all.  White beers aren’t high on my list.

Smells like butter, which could be pleasant, except that the beer has no actual buttery flavors to it. When poured from a tap it emerges without much head and very cloudy. It doesn’t look how you would expect beer to look, more like drawn butter. The flavor is harsh, and it’s hard to enjoy any texture it might have due to the gagging reflex that the taste/smell mismatch can invoke.

A very well presented beer with a sweet aroma, cloudy body, and lovely head.  Too bad they couldn’t make it taste as good as it looks and smells. Unless you like a bitter orange peel taste and high-carbonation, I wouldn’t recomend this beer.

From bottle into weizen glass.  Pale yellow head with cloudy golden color.  Slightly estery aroma, not as strong as i would’ve liked.  Flavor was mild and LIGHTLY sour. Finished easy.  Not a comples beer, but tasty enough.
Pours cloudy orange with quarter inch head.  Aroma is hops and citrus.  Taste contains orange and a hint of pepper.  Taste is too mild and hard to discern.  Carbonation heavy.

If one would put this in a glass and not tell you what it is, you will definitely describe it as a belgian style, especially with the cloudy appearance.  I knew what it was from the beginning, so I may be biased in my rating.  Definitely an excellent aroma, very fruity smell.  The flavor initially was like a flat beer, but got better after a few more sips.  No aftertaste whatsoever for me.  I would definitely recommend this for the consumer with a thin wallet.  An excellent attempt by one of the "Big Three".

Draft - This is a pretty solid wheat beer and very easy to find.  It has a thin head that stuck around awhile, leaving a bit of lacing.  Somewhat cloudy appearance, sweet flavor with a bit of citrus, very easy to drink.  I skip the orange slice my usual bar always serves with it.

One of my favorite wheat beers, and readily available most places. Rather cloudy out of the bottle, unfiltered. Aroma has the smell of citrus fruit. A simple beer, but a slightly complex taste... not sure how that works, but thats how I would describe it.  Heavily carbonated, but seemed to fit well.
A simple beer - it looks pale coming out of the bottle, has little chunks in it, and the taste is somewhat refreshing. It’s a good social beer that makes a good impression.
Draft  Puors a hazy yellow.  Aroma is flowery with hints of citrus.  Lively mix of citrus and spice taste.  Decent aftertaste.
Bottle.  Light, fruity taste.  Nice white head.  Citrus flavor very apparent.  Not a bad U.S. brewed White.

Light flowery aroma with hints of cloves, not overly sweet with a clean finish, sits very well in the mouth. Lot’s of people add orange or lemon, i prefere it with out. This is a great fall beer by the firepit enjoying some chili.

Biscuity malts, wheat and citrus character are all apparent in the aroma, but no real spiciness.  Opaque, tan yellow body with a low off white head that recedes to ring.  Citrus and wheat flavours are strong along with mild banana esters.  Spiciness is subdued and mostly apparent on the tongue in the aftertaste.  Very gassy medium body with strong, crisp, pointy carbonation.  Seems like a decent American Wheat beer but a bit too dumbed down for a witbier.  Sampled on tap at the Sandlot at Coors Field.

Pours a yellow hazy color with a light head that dissipates quickly. A noticeable sweetness and citrus flavor.  I like this beer, but I hate when it is served to me with an orange.  Beer should never have any additives in my opinion.

On tap: Yeasty aroma, it was hard to see if it was clear or had a nice belgian white haze because it was served to me in a frosted pint glass.  This beer started out okay, but towards the end I had a hard time finishing my pint, it had an odd flavor to it.  Thin white head.

On tap at BW-3s: Cloudy yellow-orange color, quickly diminishind off-white head, citrus spice aroma, (with orange slice added), very carbonated citrus flavor, spices, not very complex palate, wheaty taste.
Taste a little like celery.  Kind of disgusting.  I drank 3 and gave up.  Not anything I want to buy again.

Light flowery aroma with hints of cloves, hazy light amber appearance, small fizzy head, citrus and cloves flavor, not overly sweet with a clean finish, sits very well in the mouth.  Reliably drinkable and has found a regular spot in my rotation.
Small creamy head over a light orange honey color. Light spicy sweet aroma. Sweet, moderately clean finish.
Old reliable.....good price and always available.  Though not as full flavored as a true Belgian, it has all the characteristics.
Liked the peppery citrus aroma and the finish.  I was suprised when I found out it was made by Coors.  Not a bad job for a macrobrewery.

Had a small creamy head with a light orange cloudy color.  I thought it tasted a little like celery.  I tasted it first without the orange and then with the orange and I liked the added orange flavor.
On tap.  Hazy straw yellow.  No head. Garnished with an orange.  Spicy and wheaty, but mostly I smelled the orange.  It had a nice citus/spicey flavor.  Lots of carbonation over the tongue.  Not bad.

Hazy orange-yellow, barely a small white head and even that doesn’t last. Sweet candyish orange, very mild spice in the aroma. Flavour is more bland than expected, mild bitterness and muted muddled yeast and orange. Not quite medium body, but the palate is excellent for a macro brew. Thanks for this one beerandblues2.
pours a peach apricot color smells of yeast and wheat. taste is spice and wheat. a little orange peel. pretty nonexiting. i couldn’t drink too many of these or i would fall asleap.
This is not bad coming out of a macrobrewery.  Blue Moon is the Coors Brewing Company’s best beer.  For an ale, it has a very crisp taste like the hefeweizen.

12 oz. bottle - pours a hazy golden color, with a decent head that dissapates quickly. Very little lacing. Aroma is mostly wheat with strong hints of coriander and spices. Flavor is right on with the aroma, mostly coriander and wheat. Mouthfeel is smooth and a tad spicy, very nice. Finish is short and dominated with nuances of coriander. This is actually a very nice beer, especially for a mass-market beer from Coors.

decent beer for a girl.  sweet and fruity but with a twist that needs covering.  no wonder they mask it with an orange slice.  

i’m nicknaming this one "needs a pair".

12 oz bottle, best before March 12 06 printed on the bottle neck. 

Hazy golden in color, small fizzy head.

aroma is wheat, corn, some corriander, maybe some clove, a little sourness.
Flavor was creamy wheat with some corriander spice thrown in.

Not terrible, I could see myself drinking this again, just not paying for it.

Poured with average sized creamy white head, did exhibit some lacing.  Nose of wheat and citrus and perhaps some coriander?.  Initial taste is slightly sweet, finish is a little light, but spicy and leaves a nice aftertaste.  To be quite honest, I am suprised something this good comes out of Coors.  I’m afraid there may be some macro-bias in some of the reviews though.
This is a great beer, one of my favorites. Pours a golden cloudy haze with a decent.head Tons of citrus flavors in this. Drop an orange in it, double the fun.

nice cloudy body, with a decent foamy head. I hate the stupid orange they give you. The beer stands on its on without the fruit(it already has enough fruit and spice) pretty much a traditional white ale.I prefer Sam Adams’ white spring ale more, but not a bad brew.

Re-rating this one up.  Had it again and enjoyed it very much.  Served with an orange slice (why?).  Aroma was delicious fruit and wheat.  Flavor was same as aroma.   Both held well up through the end of the glass.
Not good.  Too wheaty and hopsy.  My wife got this on a trip to target.  I’m divorcing her tomorrow.  Yuck!!!
Draft.  Had a sweet citrusy aroma.  The flavor, that which could be tasted (not much to begin with), had similar citrus elements.  A very drinkable beer, but no notes of distinction.

Blue Moon.  Hmmmmm.  Sit down at the bar looking for a halfway decent brew out of the meager selection.  They got Blue Moon a decent Witbeer.  I order.  The bring back a mug with an orange on the side, so I throw the orange in the ashtray and continue to taste the beer. A very cloudy light yellow consistency with minimal white head.  Wheaty, very citrusy, and spices.  And a note to the bartenders out there stop putting oranges on the side of witbeers.  I like the taste of the beer and don’t need to dilute it with an orange.

12 oz. bottle. Hazy, light gold pour, looks a bit darker that other witbiers I have tried. Quick fading white head, almost no lacing. Nose is mostly coriander and wheat. Flavor matches the nose, mostly coriander and wheat. While smooth, it does not excite the tongue like better whites. The coriander flavor really hangs with you in the finish, detracting from an otherwise pretty good experience. I am shocked, however, to find out that this is a Coors product - not great, but CLEARLY the best this brewer has to offer - head and shoulders above the other Coors products. NOTE: sampled this back to back with the Hoegaarden White, and the Hoegaarden was so good I may have been too harsh on the Blue Moon. Either way, if you like this beer, nail down a Hoegaarden - you won’t go back!
GREAT beer....I am not really a "fruit" beer kinda person, but this is great with an orange slice.  It is a little expensive at the bar ($4-$5 draft), but worth it to try

Given this is coors this is very good!  Not a huge flavor, but definitely drinkable.  Drank at Old Chicago.  Power went out!  Halloween!  Thought this was some kind of trick.  No joking, this was real.  Flavor is okay... enhanced by orange.  Shouldn’t need that.  However, decent by Coors standards.  I would drink again if nothing else was avalable.  If Coors was the only brand available I would have to decide between Killians and Belgian White.  Not terrible.

On tap at Rivers Restaurant, Chicago, IL. Hazy light yellow hued having small white diminishing head with spare lacing.  Not sure the head was killed as the result of unwanted lemon slice contamination.  Soft carbonation.  Light malty citrus aroma (thanks to the lemon slice contamination).  Light-to-medium bodied that starts and finishes with slightly sweet malty flavor with some light bitterness.  A refreshing, drinkable wheat beer.
Not a very interesting beer in my opinion. Easy to drink, sure, but it leaves something to be desired.
oh its very very smooth.  it tastes just right.  easily keeps the night going with no fuss, just sweet smooth creamy beer.  lite n lemony.  keep em going. perfect session beer, esp. if its cheap.
Pretty good, but I’ve had far better whites.  a bit too much spice in this one.  If there’s a contest between this, Bud, and Miller, certainly go for Blue Moon.
Hazy gold with medium white head. Light citrus aroma. Clean tasting, again with predominate citrus flavors. Slightly acidic astringent finish. Thirst quenching, but not particularly distinguished.

Tap at Holy Grail in Cincinnati.  Pours like any other wit, except for the orange slice in it ... silly bartender.  Anyway, this was my first foray into white beers back in the day, and man, has it been left in the dust.  I mean, it’s decent and drinkable, but boring.  There’s the requisite wheat and lemon citrus, but none of the spice.  I guess cutting corners is what to expect from mass brewed beers.

I would swear something changed in the taste and feel of this beer since its introduction.  What seemed to be a mild imitation of a Belgian White now seems like a flat-tasting very average American light beer.

Wonderful, surprising beer. Beautiful golden cloudy color. Extremely smooth drinking, feels thicker than it really is at first. Try both with and without the traditional slice of orange. Great easy to find beer.

Shining cloudy gold with a solid white cover. Straightforward lemon and coriander nose does not feel too up front, rather well integrated in fact, so is the vanilla. Fairly malty in mouth, it remains quite sweet, but the balancing acidity has the sufficient force to avoid stickiness. A textbook example.

Had this on tap at the maryland renaissance faire.  Little to no taste really. There were some hop charasteristics. I could definently tell that they had attempted to make a witbier, the palate was just too subdued for me to care. Really....don’t buy this. Don’t damn yourself to the purgatory between micro and macro.

For a beer from a major brewer and highly accessible, this is remarkably above-average; I was pleasantly surprised.  This truly defines "light session" beer, the kind of thing one would go after to quench one’s thirst without an insult to one’s palate.  At the corner supermarket with a pretty general selection, mostly of macros, this is in the far-and-away top three along with SNPA (a superior but not as much a session beer) and Sam Adams.

Pours a hazy yellowish color.  Head disolves rather quickly.  Mild Citrus and floral taste and aroma.  This was my first Belgian white beer and while it’s not the best out there,  It sparked in interest for me ito try many others in the style.

I have fallen in love with this beer. I just hope my girlfriend doesn’t find out. It leaves you with a sweet nectareen aftertaste. I wish I could drink this beer and only this beer for the rest of my life.
Of course its not the best out there.  But as far as "mainstream" beers go this is my favorite.  It’s easy to find and beats the pants of bud and miller and all that crap!
Pouts a light golden with fast dissipating white head.  Fruity, floral, lemons in nose.  Cloves prominent.  Citrus tasting.  Not a bad beer, especially considering the brewer
this beer had a very smooth finish with a crisp clean aftertaste. nothing overly special about this beer but it is good to drink to compliment a meal. nice brew

had this one alot but just not rating it! Golden blonde with distinct taste of coors brewing products, citurs, wheat and malt nose, decent medium body, watery finish..pretty simple but good on a hot day
The aroma is a light spice coupled with hints of oarnge.  Blue Moon is cloudy and light golden in color.  There is a light spicey oarnge flavor and the body is medium.

Bottle poured a cloudy yellow.  The spice in this beer came through a bit more than any other taste, but there were some fruity orange notes in there.  Fairly well balanced beer with a decent amount of carbonation to give it a bit of zest.
Beer is hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is light honey with some orange.  Flavor is fairly bland, light citrus and spice. The light body is lifeless and thin.
How can you make a white beer with almost no taste?  Refreshing on a hot summer day, with a bit of orange juice in the background.  Almost want to put ice in it and call it a beer spritzer.

Pours a nice hazy yellow color.  Decent aroma of orange, spices and coriander. Has a slight tartness on the palate with some spicey notes. Body is smooth somewhat full bodied. Finish is quick and dry. A refreshing beer.

Bottle at the Brickskeller (and a million other times because somehow I haven’t rated this one yet): Slightly hazy yellow with a bit of an orange tint.  Medium white head sticks atop the beer and provdes some nice lacing around the glass.  The aroma is estery, showing off more clove than banana, a hint of corriander, spice, and light fruit notes.  Taste is spicy (corriander, clove, pepper) with notes of banana, floral hops, toast, and a bit of wheat.  Light-medium bodied, excellent medium carbonation, tiny bubbles that really cleanse the palate.

This is the beer I used to drink before discovering the world of RateBeer. I had it yesterday because it was a $2 draft and it still has some good sweetness with its coriander, orange and spice tones. It still has a decent body but it seems to go flat easily and it really isn’t interesting enough for me to call it a Belgian White. Drinkibility is there but the taste is above average at best.
12 oz bottle: the pours a hazy golden orange.  aroma is mostly of sweet oranges and spice. seems one dimensonal. i think it lacks they yeast belgian wit character.
a cloudy fizzy yellow beer but had a decent taste served with an orange not to bad but not to good

Murky, golden/tan, white head fading fast. I’ve always liked the packaging, so an extra point for appearance. Aromas starts dry and floral with lemon, but turns rather harsh and nutty as it warms, with an inkling of burnt toast. Spicy flavor, mildly sweet/sour on a wheat base. Dry palate, but leaves a phlegmy throat and roof-of-mouth. Too unrefined to be a good Wit.



Cub Foods, Tinley Park, IL

Very citrusy and very smooth. Aroma has a distinct fruity, tangerine almost smell to it. Taste is unlike many beers i’ve tasted probably due to the distinct citrus flavor. The aftertaste, however, is one of the best i’ve ever experienced as it is very subtle yet hangs around for a while. I drank this out of the bottle poured into a pint glass.
Bottle.  Cloudy white head.  Very citrus...seems like oranges and coriander to me.   Not bad but everything is average.  Refreshing, however and so it has to be considered successful.

Bottle. Drank this straight out of the bottle after consuming more than a few drinks. It was quite tasty - I was surprised, kind of spicy, light, and fruity. Almost tasted like blueberries and/or citrus to me, though I must admit that I was (still am) intoxicated. Seemed very light on the palate, crisp, and refreshing. I’d like to try it again when I’m sober. Edit: Tried it again sober and I still likeit. I’m surprised.

First one was returned because of the fruit slice in my glass.  Decent wheat grass- like flavors along with a distinct lemon brightness.  An attempt at unusual "Belgian-style" spicing, mainly coriander.  Not that bad.
On tap.  really enjoyed this one or two.  Served with orange slices, enhanced the flavor.  Will drink again.
Thin, white head. Slight citrusy aroma.  Citrus taste-definitely can taste the orange.  Smooth, refreshing beer. Very slight carbonation.  Sweet aftertaste.
Cloudy with a small white head.  Mild aroma of citrus.  Flavor is sweet malt with citrus and coriander.  Light and refreshing, but not my favorite style.
Tastes better on tap then in the bottle.  Very unique cloudy look.  A sweet flavor that for the most part people drinking it  have to be in the proper mood.

draft....cloudy orange appearance with medium white head. aroma is a tad indistinct...a touch of citrus notes and hops...flavor is actually quite appetizing (orange peel, lemony hops)...palate is average

Bottle&Draft:  This beer is suprisingly sweet.  It has a mild aroma and taste, not too complex, overpowering or fantastic, but nothing rubs me the wrong way like most macros now do.  Its major flavors are citrus (orange) and vanilla.  Has a cloudy appearnce with a nice white head and some carbonation.

Draft. Served with an orange slice for variety. Guess this is kind of the "Shoebox Greetings" of the megabeers. Surprisingly cloudy… does that mean it’s unpasteurized? Fine white head and a soft wheat taste that’s actually a bit chewy. A touch of coriander without the yeasty esters of other wits. Finishes light, but then I get some hint of adjunct corns. Nice lacing.

Although I like this beer, I need to be in the mood for it.  It has a very strange orangey flavor.  And most people do put an orange slice in it.  It comes out very cloudy, as if it is going to be a very thick drink.  It is very full of flavor, but I can’t stand more than one.  The orange flavor just doesn’t do it for me.

Draught and bottle. cloudy straw/golden, white head. Draught was served with orange slice. Not a whole lot of aroma.  Malty, sweet, nice wheat balnce, citrus and coriander, tangy and refreshing. Some yeast flavors as well.

It should be noted that there can be a big difference from bottle to bottle with this beer. On tap, especially with a wedge of orange, it’s almost always silky and refreshing. Very even carbonation, with flavor of yeast and wheat. Again, there are times when Blue Moon isn’t as good as normal, but for the most part, it’s quite good. I’ve noticed this same problem with Coors Light (a bad to decent beer for it’s class), and considering that Coors distributes Blue Moon, there might be something to it.
Aroma is a plain sweet sugar. Flavor has an almost floral, perfume like characteristic, over some general wheat and lemons. Palate really lacks, with a dose of water.

I’m not a huge fan of belgian whites, but when I try a good one I know it.  This is just poor.  Watered down, odd flavors, and way too sweet.  I didnt know when I was drinking it that it was made by a swill brewer, but now that i see that i feel better about not enjoying it.

Pretty good "microbrew" style offering for such a large company.  Tied with Killian’s Red for my favorite Coors beers.  Great typical white-style citrus and coriander flavor with hefe-like cloudiness and mouthfeel.  No reason to drink bad lagers if this is available.

Great beer. Smells great not as couldy as some Belgian whites. 
Goes down really smooth.
Is better on tap than in a bottle.

Pours with a three-finger white head that fades quickly leaving no lace.  Light cloudy amber color with some yeast left in the bottle.  Light bodied and light carbonation.   Nose is wheat.  Starts with some sweetness, some cloves and a clean finish.  Nice.  $5.74 for a 6-pack of 12oz from Super Walmart Concord, NH.  Label has it brewed by Blue Moon Brewing Co.
Wow what a surprise to see and drink at a small hotel bar. A nice crisp delightful tasting beer. A beer to recomend to those stuck on the big 3 TV commercialized alcohol laden water drinkers.
This ’perfumy’ beer deserves to be more widely available than it seems to be.

Rather enjoyed this beer from the draft.  Had a great looking color and was cloudy.  Good sweet flavor, but not overpowering any other aspects of the beer.  Good overall balance and a good summer treat.  Not bad for a specialy macro brew

12 oz bottle - 3.2% ABW.  Pours a very cloudy and murky golden almost brownish.  It has a fizzy white head that quickly disappears completely.



The aroma is yeast, corriander, wheat and some musty fruitiness.



The flavor is pretty subdued for a wit.  There’s sweet malt and wheat with some yeast and spiciness but it’s pretty far in the background.  It has a slightly bitter finish.  There’s some unpleasant acidic mustiness.  The mouthfeel is pretty watery and undercarbonated.



Overall, a decent offering by macro standards, but pretty substandard for a wit.
Poured a hazy pale straw color with a thin white head.    Aroma and flavors of orange, lemon, and clove.  Lightly sweet.
Pours muddy tan. Aroma of citrus and yeast. Flavor is sweet lemon, spice and no hop bitterness. Thin body. Lacks character, but drinkable.

I first tried this on tap and loved it. Still good in the bottle. Pours opaque, color and vapors are of orange and white cholocate. Sometimes creamy, low carbonation, but far from flat. Good with a hearty dinner. Update: I just tasted black pepper! And I didn’t have any today, so it must be burried deep in the beer. Interesting.

I like everything about this beer, From the nearly Opaque orange color, to the subtle tast of orange peel.  I prefer this beer to any other after a long day on the mountain bike.  It’s the perfect settle-down beer!

I prefer this on tap to bottled.

On tap served with a slice of orange on the glass- Pours cloudy orange with a very short tan head.  Aroma is of spices, yeast, and just a touch of orange peel.  Flavor is about the same.  Dry finish and light on the palate.  A nice summer beer and it was the best available at the bar.
Not a bad cheap beer.  It is a pretty lame version of a belgian white, though.  It has all the parts just kinda weak.

Until now, I was not aware that this was a MolsonCoors production. Hazy straw color.  Spicy, yeast aroma with a touch of citrus.  Light bodied and dry with a gentle hint of carbonation.  Mixed flavors of yeast, spice, lemon, and grapefruit abound.  A mild hit of hops finishes this one off.
Pours light and tastes lights.  A citrus flavor come through.  Had it on draught while eating at a resturant outside on a hot day.  This beer is good for that and not much more.

Bottle.   Clove, coriander, wheat and banana aromas.  Light golden yellow color - cloudy with little head.  Sweet clove and orange flavor.  Really a pretty decent Witbier given that it’s a Coors product.
12 oz bottle-pours a white head.  Color is a yellow-gold cloudy.  Taste is middle of the road.  Nice carbonation.  Finish has a little bite.

Bottle.  Hazy gold with a thin, fizzy light-tan head that diminishes rapidly.  Wheaty, lemony and yeasty aroma.  Crisp and refreshing with some tangy lemon and orange and a wheaty base.  Very peppery and spicy with a little coriander.  Short, nothing-lingering finish.  Better than I thought it would be.

Tasty stuff, good appearance for a wit, decent spicing, the orange is a bit subdued, but I picked up something reminiscent of cardamom, which isn’t quite appropriate for a wit, but this overall this isn’t a bad wit, and a good choice on a hot day. 355mL bottle.

On tap, this ranks up there with some other very good wit beers. The great thing is you can get it almost anywhere. Thin, whispy head with a hazy golden color. I love the fact that it’s unfiltered. Nice coriander and orange flavor and aroma that complement the wheat. Nice aftertaste. Especially good on a hot day.

I was very surprised when I ordered this beer on a whim in a pub in Washington D.C..  Very flavorful and absolutely no aftertaste!  As soon as I returned home to Orange County, I went out and bought myself a 12-pack.

This great stuff!  There is no doubt that if this were brewed in Belgian instead of here in the states it would rate around a 1/2 point higher.....at least!  Don’t get me wrong, this isn’t Hoegarrden....but it’s close and unlike Hoegarrden can be found EVERYWHERE and is cheap! ....$6.49/ 6 pack.  THIS IS IN NOT BREWED BY COORS!! COORS BOUGHT THE RIGHTS TO THE COMPANY "BLUE MOON" THEY MAKE THE MONEY NOT THE BEER!!
I like this stuff, it has a lean aftertaste, and tastes good goin’ down. Fruity as hell!  Very good, one of  my favorites, even if it is Coors.
Great beer.  Very cloudy appearance. Best on tap but bottles are decent.  A little heavy for mass consumption but a very nice change from the usual.  Great with a slice of orange.
Bottle.  Lemons and other citrus and banana flavors.  Something slightly off with out bottle I’m guessing, as there was something  in it that reminded me of an industrial cleaner chemical.

Blue moon eh?  They should call this stuff the real coors.  People would probably drink it more often.  I picked this up thinking that I was being original (sorry, I’m a newb) and I look here.....COORS....wtf?  So anyway, it’s not bad compared to most american beers.  The head...what head?  It’s like a 1/8th of an inch thich and disappears faster than Eminem’s career.  So the appearance isn’t all that impressive, but the flavor is like....hmmmm, banannas, I agree on that note and is smooth to the palate.  Very thick actually.  The color is a bit more opaque than other American beers which is probably why they don’t just slap Coors on the label.  Anyhow, it’s worth a 6 pack at least and if you hate it, just give it to the moochers.  Save the PBR and Schlitz for yourself.
Sort of a joke of a beer.  Coors attempt of something worhwhile.  Not a huge fan of the style, and this is a particularly lackluster example.  The choice of people who don’t know anything about beer.

Very attractive, it looked excellent. Light golden with very white head. Aroma is light hops, some light grains, citrus, tiny bit of yeast and some banana. Taste is crisp and smooth. Some wheat and a tiny bit of that yeast and citrus again. Finish is very clean. This was over too quick. Wait... coors makes this? That can’t be right.

Draft; so I see this one coming toward me with a slice of orange wedge in the top of the mug and I could not get the orange out of my head the entire taste. Orange-yellow color and hazy- reminded me of a glass of orange juice I had for breakfast. Small pure white head that deminished quickly. Orange aroma, orange taste, watery, lively carbonation. I think I just found my new breakfast beer!

Bottle dated Oct 09 153471T 05. Pours with slight head which fades fast like carbonated lemonade. Dark Mountain Dew/Mello Yello color, but with grassy shadows eminent. Slight hop smell mixed with stillgreensagebrush, tangerine, overripe but not repellant citrus. Rind. Peel. Nice bitter afterbite. First had this on tap at a Chicago style pizza joint in Lincoln, NE. If memory serves, bottles not quite as good as the tap (isn’t that always the case?) but still very good. A nice white. Is it really brewed by Coors?Yellow bullet? Were it a woman, I’d ask for a second date... then straight back to my place, or else.

Citrus aroma, good stuff.  Mouthfeel almost like orange juice.  Slightly effervescent.  Cloudy body with a small white head and some lacing,  Very drinkable, not a bad beer.  Hard to believe this is brewed by Coors!

Had this on tap.  Poured a cloudy yellow with a thin white head.  Standard light witbier aroma, but light and watery on flavor and palate.  Was able to pull out some citrus and ginger.  Not a bad witbier, but nothing special.
a bit light but has a nice taste that contains a little spice.  i like this beer, love their pumpkin ale... one reason to look towards fall.
The taste is rather interesting, spicy is a way to describe it. The first one is alright, however after 1 or 2 that was enough of that.
a prettygood white beer.  Lots of spice flavor and goes down pretty smooth.  just can’t drink to many of these though in one sitting
On draught.  Pours yellow and cloudy, almost opaque with no real noticeable head.  Smells lightly of oranges, coriander and bananas.  Taste is watery with some coriander notes and a processed finish.

Smells like a witbier, looks like a witbier, but doesnt really taste like a witbier. Dont get me wrong, its a good cheap session beer, but it is completely forgettable.  Not much to write about. Like I said, a good presentation for the most part, but lackluster taste. Pretty light and watery, like Hoegaarden.
really good white with a great taste of ginger and a final of herbs the only bad point the appearance not typical orange-yellow

Aroma:Wheat,citrus frui,coriander....
Appearance:hazy yellow with chunk of yeast,small withe head...
Flavor:good citrus fruit flavor,coriander,sweet is a good withe beer..
kind of thin... slightly cloudy ..head small and disapates very quick..... lots of citrus ... also a hint coriander...
A good summer beer when there is no corona about. A little too light for me to drink regularly.

I was pleasantly surprised by this beer.  I had it on tap after 16 hours of traveling, so maybe any beer would have tasted good after all of that.  It had a spicy aroma and the color was a golden cloudy color with minimal white head.  The flavor was decent with some citrus and spice.  Not too bad overall.

I like this beer in moderation in the summertime. Its cheap and it holds up moderately to other wheats on tap in the area (Penn Weizen, Hoegaarden, Brooklyner Weisse, etc) but definitly not the best. Cloudy off-orange appearance. Citrusy and hoppy floral notes on the nose masked by cheapness of Coors.  Its a bit sweet and hard to down more than a few of these in one sitting. Why do they put fruit in beer? I took the orange slice out that was floating in my beer.
Slightly cloudy, amber color with small white head. A bit thin, fair spice flavor but not too exciting.
Hints of orange, sweet spices.  Decent summer brew.  Grew tired of the flavor; its definitely a once-in-a-while kind of beer.

Pale hazed golden, fizzy white head.  Lightly spiced corriander-like nose with softer tones of citrus, wheat, and wet white bread.  Flavor was up front orange and lemon zest, sweet spices, and dried wheat, with a touch of hop bitterness to round it out.  Light to medium bodied, light carbonation, spiced, wheaty,  juicy citrus finish.  A good summertime crossover brew for the newbie beer geek...
Not bad for a mass produced beer from Coors Brewing Co.  The aroma had a bit of a tea thing going on.  This one pours a cloudy gold color.

Pours a light golden with a thin head of fine carbonation that quickly recedes.  Aroma of spice and metal, slightly unpleasant.  But I could just be looking for macro swill qualities.  Tastes better than it smells.  Citrus is the first thing I taste, presumably from the orange peel, hopefully not from any of the ’natural flavors’.   This is a very misleading term and I wish the FDA would change it.   I really do not taste the wheat, and that is why this beer is mediocre in my opinion.  Not to mention it is brewed by Coors and shilled as Belgium beer.  The aftertaste is questionable but not bad.  The first witbier I ever brewed was better than this.   I won’t refuse a Blue Moon, but you won’t find it in my fridge again.

First witbier I’ve sampled....somehow expected it to be darker.  Pours a cloudy gold color with a white head that quickly disappears.  Aroma has hints of oranges, for sure.  Taste is citrusy on the front and then spices in the finish.

Bottle, Plenty of head cause I poured it goofy, but it quickly disappated.  Cloudy nice color a little to the red of golden.  Inital odor is of oranges and coriander, as has been said, but below that there is a pungent smell that is not entirely pleasant, perhaps my bottle is old.  Taste includes a little of the odor, a little bit of belgian yeast and malt, and then it goes a bit bland.  Nice for a grocery store beer, but other beers are spoiling me vs. this.

first time i rated this beer, it didnt score high, but after i have sampled more 3 months later i liked it more, aroma is ok, appearance was hazy golden with a decent fizzy white head, taste is wheat, spice, malt, much better the second time around, first time it scored a 2.5 with me.
A unique beer for the grocers fridge. I liked it 3 or 4 of these is plenty, could not drink it regulary. still searching gor the #1 belgian ale and this ain’t it.

Bottle.  No head at all.  Yes, I taste the orange and coriander but the problem with this beer is the lack of body.  Yes its "unfltered" but close your eyes and you cannot tell.  An option if you intend to drink more than two.
This stuff was allright. I expected more for the price of it for god sakes. Dont ever give me a beer with a freaking orange in it either! gay.

Served a translucent yellow with a thin white head and an orange slice, the orange is nice for appearance, but I decided to remove it.  A really soft and sweet aroma, slight citrus and even slighter spice.  The flavor was sweet and slightly spicey, with strong malt flavors.  The body was good, the beer smooth, but it seemed to be a little light on the carbonation, perhaps due to the slice of orange.  Overall a good beer, but I’d rather have an Oberon, a Whitsun, or a Zoomer Wit.

I used to swear by this beer...now it agitates me. Doesnt hit me as true wheat beer, the haze is probably artificial. Flavor is rather weak as well. Still a refreshing Belgian with nice hints of orange and corriander.

Pours a cloudy, golden raisin color with a foamy white head.  Tart, citrusy, and floral nose.  Flavor depth is weak, almost non-existent.  Touches of tart lemon,  grass and yeast.  Finishes tangy with a hint of hops.  Smooth, easy drinking and refreshing.  Has a good medium density to it.  It has almost no flavor,  but, oddly enough,  is somehow enjoyable.  I’m not really sure how that happened.

Tasted without obligatory orange slices.  Poured from a bottle.  Nice fruity aroma and aftertaste.  Slightly hazy, amber color.  Light, dry, refreshing taste.  Head didn’t last.  Can’t imagine why anyone would want to add fruit to it!

Pours a hazy pale gold with a thin creamy head. Beer is very fizzy. Smells sour and spicy. Floral qualities as well.

Tastes spicy and of citrus. Hints of apple cider and a bit yeasty. Light bodied with a sour finish. Refreshing and very drinkable. Nothing spectacular but a solid white ale.

Several years ago this was my backup beer. I could get a six-pack at the Navy comissary for $3.99 so I have a bit of a soft spot for this beer since I could get nothing of this quality for a comparable price.
Had this served to me with an orange slice on the rim of the glass.  Very citrusy aroma, yellowish look to it.  Very light sweet taste to it, very refreshing.  Too sweet to drink more than a couple.
Pours cloudy yellow-white with decent white head.  Grassy citrusy aroma.  Flavors of wheat, bread, citrus, and a little coriander.  Nice flavor, balance, and palate.

Aroma is like apple and other citrusy smells. Head is very thick and lingers . Color is a cloudy, light honey appearance. Taste is where this brew really excels. It is light and refreshing. Something to enjoy outside on a warm summer evening. Light carbonation hits the front of the tongue, whereas the citrusy sweetness is revealed in the finish, and stays a short while. Warning to hop fans. There is no hop ’bite’ here. It is smooth and light. A very drinkable beer. I like this one.

Yuck.  This was some nasty stuff.  Tasted like it was mechanically carbonated to me.  There was very little else to like, either, without much beer flavor but no real spice or herbal flavors either.  Stay away.

Bottle - on a beautiful Sprin Night at RFK Stadium watching a ball game.

No beer can ask for a better environment to be sampled at...

Looked good, smelled very nice - certainly a step up from the other ballpark swill on offer.  But this is way too carbonated - the acrid bubbles overwhelm whatever subtleties are in this beer.  An underwhelming flavour, and so much carbonation that a second was out of the question.
Great warm weather beer, but nice all around. Could almost be an aperitif. Fruity, a little spice, smooth as can be.
A delicious and refreshing brew with a spicy, fruity aroma.  Great on a hot summer’s evening at dinnertime.  Unlike many beers, this can actually be drunk for taste.

Aromas of the Hop and Yeast variety. Grass and trees almost like most back yards. Cloudy yellow body with average head that disipated to a thin layer over top of beer. Flavor of spice and fruit. The fruit flavor made this beer for me because otherwise the heavy spice would of not done the palate well. Good Beer.
Draft. Little head and cloudy gold. Aroma is a bit yeasty. Flavor is good, mildly spicy. Bubbles were a bit big and feel was off some. Need to rate with paper in front of me next time.

Poured cloudy straw yellow with a good head and lacing.
Aroma of yeast and malt.
Flavor is crisp with a light malt and yeast finish.
Not bad for a corner store beer.
On tap.. Light golden color with a medium head.  Aroma was a bit of yeast and some fruitiness.  Flavor was mild yeast and a bit of floral and fruitiness and a bit of wheat.  Refreshing beer..
This golden wheat beer pours with a short head that dissipates quickly. The hoppy flavor is actually very pleasant, with a hint of spice and orange. In my opinion, this beer is underrated.

Citrusy, hoppy aroma, very light. 
Poured cloudy yellow with thin diminishing white head. Constant carbonation from the bottom.
Starts bittersweet, citrus hops prevalent.
Finish is smooth and sweet. Short aftertaste.

Esther: tres fruity and dry, je la rachetrai bien volontiers...

Juju: ben arome laisse presumer un bon gout caramel helas il ny est pas en bouche par contre elle tres plaisante et pour le prix un bon rapport qualite prix

6$ pour le pack de 6 a Safeway
Did not really have any taste - the aroma was good, but the flavor was neutral. Not offensive, but not worth seeking out.

So yeah. I used to like this. Then I tried like 10 other beers in the style and saw a lot of flaws. It’s a nice cloudy golden body, but after that it’s downhill. Weak Wit aroma with plastic and other junk. Flavor is the same making this a pretty pathetic Wit.

Cloudy tan colour.  Might be the ugliest wit I’ve ever seen, at least amongst unfiltered ones.  Filtered ones are so much more heinous.  Aroma shows a little curacao and some sweaty yeast notes that remind of suntan lotion.  In short, it smells like a pleasant afternoon in Aruba.  The tastes is remarkably similar with phenolic curacao and yeast sweat intermingling under a blanket of dull, plodding malts.  Because this beer is every bit as uncool as mixing metaphors, it is like a bad karaoke version of a really good song.

This is an *excellent* Witbier! I was quite surprized at just how good it was. As is typical of the beer snobs, since this is brewed by some obscure American brewery in Tennessee, it gets a paultry rating...but such is the way things are in the extreme snobbery of the beer world (thank God we’re not in the WINE world where the snobber is even more frickin’ disgusting!)

Anyway, bottom line, this is a very fine Belgian White.
Stinks like the U.S. mint. Gives way to bread, grain, citrus. The taste is slightly metallic with yeast and some zest. This really could be worse.

An excellent choice.  It has a crisp taste with a better than average aftertaste.  I believe it to be better with the addition of a slice of orange.  Better on tap than in the bottle.  Very affordable, which  being a college guy, price is definitely included in a beer rating.
Draft at Lake Powell Lodge.  Cloudy yellow.  Does that really say owned by Coors?  Not a bad drink at all.

not quite up to par against some of the witbiers i have had recently.  didnt bring alot to the table in terms of aroma, just  a slight sweetness.  was much cloudier and yellowish than i consider spec.  the flavor was also rather bland in comparison to hoegarden or victory.  it did have a very crisp mouthfeel and an easy drinkability, but overall, i think this was a downgraded version of the family for the mainstream crowd.

Pours a hazy orange/yellow color. Lots of sediment floating around. Aroma is sweet and slightly yeasty. Some orange peel aroma as well. Taste is somewhat sweet and grainy. Some fruitiness as well. Enjoyable.

Bottle. Very hazy gold with some yeast bits settling to the bottom. Decent frothy white head. Aromas of citrus, banana, yeast, and some pepper. Very refreshing. Yummy coriander and spicy yeast flavors with a sweet wheat malt flavor from beginning to end. Is it Hoegaarden? Not Quite. Is it a very tasty, light bodied, refreshing BELGIAN style beer made by one of the so called big three evil brewers? Yes! Give props to Coors for making a style of beer the other big two wouldn’t touch, making it inexpensive, and making it availiable everywhere and with decent quality.
a very nice wheat made by, what? coors?  i am very surprised, but it’s a decent wheat ale.

Draft - big citrusy, malty aroma.  This is the best feature of the beer.  I wanted to sit and smell, but felt obligated to drink it.  Cloudy yellow to orange.   Minimal white head.  Flavor matches the aroma - sweet.  Medium mouthfeel.

This is a cloudy brew from the Coors brewing Co. Although it seem’s they wouldn’t want you to know that. Afine craft brew that could use more attention simalar to a Hefe. pours up cloudy do to the unfitered yeast great with an orange wedge. and a steak or maybe on a nice summer afternoon on the pourch just relaxing.
Pours a cloudy, gold.  Very small head that doesn’t last long at all.  Not too much taste to talk about, but not a bad beer either.  I could definitely drink a few of these though.  Not bad at all.
cloudy orange color with noisy head. smells of citrus and some banana. very appealing. taste is sweet and pleasant, but maybe a little light on flavor. nice beer though.
Some nice flavour present, just not enough of it to satisfy.  It is a good thirst quencher, but not an overly impressive beer.  Nice cloudy pour.
It’s cloudy, has a distinct citrus flavor.  The flavor is a little watery, but it’s not awful.

Nice cloudy beer.  Good orange/coriander flavors without overpowering the taste.  I like it.  Is it true to Belgian Wit, most likely a little light on everything for that, but a good beer nonetheless.

(Bottle 35,5 cl) rangey golden, hazy with a bubbly head - actually quite a noisy head... Giant yeast sediment. Loads of fruit in the aroma, and loads of coriander. Classic Belgian White. Owned by Coors?? Do they understand the term Belgian White? Nice effort though.

Very cloudy, deep gold color with a full head.    It was served with some orange slices which was new and kind of exciting.  I couldn’t tell if the aroma/ flavor of the beer was citrusy or if that was a byproduct of the oranges.  All in all a pretty tastey beer.  My first Belgian White.

Draft, Joe’s Bar and Grill, Dedham, MA: finally got around to rating this beer. Poured a deep cloudy yellow with adequate white head. Aroma is of light banana, citrus, and yeast. A liittle grainy in the flavor. Mostly light coriander and banana with touches of citrus. Mostly decent flavor. Easy drinking.

On this particular occasion I had this beer out of the bottle and having had it on tap I was quite dissapointed. If given a choice for trying this beer for the first time definately go with draft. The aroma and flavour is significantly better.

Breakfast anyone?  Call me crazy, but this beer tastes exactly like waffles, topped with fresh bananas and oranges.  Light, but not in a bad way, this beer is easy to drink, best enjoyed in good company after a good meal.
This beer  tastes like bread and plastic i dont know if i had a bad batch or what but i didnt like the taste at all.

Coors best beer..I think so! Milky yellow
brew with a tight white  creamy head.
Citrus aromas orange ,lemon and kum quats.Taste is fresh wheat slightly twangy but the citrus balnces nicely,its somewhat thin in body which increases it drinkability.Super refreshing!
Blue moon tastes great.  It smells bad, looks bad, has cheap labeling. However, it does taste good.

Tap at the Flying Saucer.  Served by Amber...long legs and a short skirt.  

The beer doesn’t need an orange slice, but what the hell.  It’ has a hazy color with a decent head.  Very easy beer.
not bad. good social drinking beer, nice for sitting outside on a hot summer day or playing croquet

This beer is one of my favorites.  Of course it is better out of the draft.  The flavor is marvelous as well with the orange taste very noticable.  I would suggest everyone try this beer.

UPDATE:  This beer is rather boring anymore, Especially after Coors took it over.  Very One Dimensional really.

The best thing about this beer for me was the aroma.  It has a well balanced fruity wheat smell.  Has nice fruity flavor and nice golded color.  I tried not to be too critical of this beer, but I’m not big on wheat beer.

cant believe i had never had this until last friday.  nice white orange color of thick haze.  huge nose of citrus and spice.  crisp wheat flavor with the refreshing flavor of orange.  highly drinkeable in the hotter climates.
Poured a golden yellow. small white head.b Clean crisp fruity aroma. Light and smooth. Good for a summer day.
I light clove allspice aroma. Poured ok  slight lacing  not much head. Lightly cloudy yellow colored. Smooth sweet flavored, a nice wheat but not the best.
Average beer with an entirely too sweet taste.  More like molases than beer.  Not a good Belgian White.
Friuty aroma with citrus hints.  Flavor same with almost flowery, soapy finish.  Its ok.
Middle of the road wit.  Sweet fruit flavors, easily drinkable.  Can’t understand why people feel it necessary to put slices of fruit in this beer.

CAn anyone get me bluemoon
in Ft.lauderdale / Dania / South Florida ?

I want to become a distributor
for this item in S. florida -
I LOVE THIS BEER AND CAN SELL
THE LIVING GOD OUT OF IT - 

I need to talk with someone who can tell me where to get this beer from a distributor !!  I have MULTIPLE potential
LARGE orders for this product
in S. Florida -

Tasty, if unremarkable offering that gets credit for being decently available. It’s a mildly spicy belgian white with tastes of blueberries and raspberries yo amke it smooth and sweet. Easy to drink a whole bottle quickly.

This is a good beer that I rather enjoy. At first I found it soapy. Upon closer examination I find it tastes like blueberries, reminiscent of Sweetwater Blue. It is crisp and refreshing, mild, and quaffable.
Pours a cloudy yellow the way a white should. Decent wheaty aroma, flavor not incredible, but not horrible. Not bad for when you have to shop at Sheetz.
Leave out the fruit and just enjoy the sweet flavor of this good belgian white.  Availability has increased tenfold since I first had this one.
Bottle. Good standard beer. Good aroma of sweet and wheat with a similar complex flavor and finish.

Bad batch/ old keg/ or something.  Smelled like Dawn dish soap.  Tasted like Cascade dish detergent.  Palate and finish the same.  I’ve had better Blue Moon, but this particular tap specimen turned my stomach.  Eww.
This is a nice brew.  A sweet taste, with a tinge of bitterness, this beer has hints of fruit and wheat.  A nice brew overall.
Bottle. Cardboard corriander nose. Has the usual notes of suntan lotion, soap, citrus, acid, and wheat. I don’t dig wit beers, and this is a bad wit beer. ’Nuff said.
Had it at Mac’s bar in East Lansing, Mich. Cloudy yellow like any other Belgian white.. white head small head.. mute aroma.. sweet spicy flavour clean smooth palate.
Always comes with a slice of orange. So smells like orange go figure. Slightly sweet, not bitter, finishes smooth. First time I tried it a gf got it i took a sip not bad.

Poured a glowing orange/straw haze, light passes easily through it. Smell is a smooth scent of lemon and some clove hints. Wheat is dominant with a little sweetness and clove is slight. The wheat notes did linger on and on. The finish was lemony and the aftertaste was yeasty. It went down quite fast. For a macro it’s not bad, it’s a good substitute for a pilsner on a hot day. My bartender suggested adding a shot of orange juice to the pint and make it a nice shandy. Hmm...I’ll let you know.

(bottle) A commonly-available beer that I put off drinking simply because of its availability - reasoning that something so widely accepted must be bland and boring. I was quite wrong (see Newcastle for another example of my flawed logic). This is a very nice beer that went down very easily. I think I could drink it all night, and that’s not something I could say about most Belgians.

this was decent.  couldy yellow color, poured from the tap like a hefe.  thick white head, but it didn’t stay around long.  served with lemon.  taste was very citrusy and fruity with wheat  background.  slight spice.  medium body and feel.  not great, not bad.
Fruity and spicy fruity.  Smokey amber color.  Great beer.  White head, one of the better beers I have had, but I still prefer Delerium Belgian Ale.

Fine sample of a Belgian White. While not as good as an overseas witbier, the flavor is very distinct. I like the unfiltered beers, as most home brewers do. I do not add the orange, as I just enjoy it straight. Good beer!
Good aroma and taste. Nice wheaty appearance, good aroma, Pours a beautiful orange amber color. Served with a twist of orange really sets this beer off.  Refreshing carbonation. Good beer!

Mass produced beer that is a welcome change from all the bitter beers Ive been drinking tonight.  This beer is traditionally served with oranges which I dont particularly car for bit nonetheless gives it an exotic flare.  The taste rings out with all sorts of citrus fruits from orange, lemon, lime, to passion fruit and kiwi.  Also the combination of the citrus flavors combined with the wheaty nature of this beer makes it unique and a commonly asked for beer in many pubs.  Nice appearance and nature so give it a go.

This beer taste and smells like fruitloops swimming in urine. seriously. I poured this out immediately and didnt even recycle the bottle. Memphis needs to stick to churning out good music and stop brewing Belgian whites.

A soapy aroma that smells like soap and lemon shavings.  Murky yellowish white hue with small amount of head that dies.  Flavor is zesty and of lemon shavings with a dash of spice or pepper. Only picked it up because it was a 6-pack on sale and it was a new item on the shelves.
only got a small taste of this.  golden yellow color with a huge head.  tasted and smelled of bananas.
Smooth enough thought it was a micro. Nice wheaty appearance, good aroma, smeet though citrusy. Refreshing carbonation

Even though I love Belgian whites I was disappointed by this beer. It smelled pretty good looked pretty good but didn’t taste like a true Belgian white should. #1 Its watered down #2 Its light fruity taste is somewhat off. #3 Astringent tasting hops. Having said that its better than most macro brews.
pretty lame attempt at a witbier.. lackluster in every way.. totally drinkable, totally boring.
Really surprisingly good for a domestic wheat ale.  Very tasty.  Has a slight fruity aroma.  Much better than most of the other beers in the Coors family.  Too bad we can’t buy it in Oklahoma.

Looks like a witbier.  Smells like a witbier (vanilla, yeast, orange zest).  Taste like a terrible attempt of a macro to cash in on the witbier bandwagon.  Quite simply, the tastes don’t mesh.  It’s like the brewery decided to put in a dash of banannas, cloves, vanilla, orange zest and some hops and malts and hoped to God that they’d hit the right recipe.  Coors missed the mark.  Stick with the silver bullet, o’ banquet beer.

Love the golden color of this beer.  "Orangy" aroma.  Surprisingly balanced and smooth.  Not typically my kind of beer but I enjoyed it quite a bit.  More than one gets a bit overwhelming.
Bottoms up.

Nice hazy golden yellow pour with a creamy white head that fades after a while but leaves a ring and a bit of lacing.  Pleasant light citrus aroma.  The flavor was that of a typical belgian white, but lighter than most. Light almost to the point of being thin, but not quite. Very lightly spiced, with predominately citrus character.  Very easy to drink, and the alcohol is not apparent at all.  Like GeniusGirl says, its a great everyday casual beer, and a good value at $6.99 a six.  Very nice and refreshing, I enjoyed it.   If you close your eyes you won’t even know you’re drinking a Coors...  ..  01/26/2007 ..  ..  On Tap at RJ Gators, Jacksonville, FL  .. .. very cloudy amber beer in a pint glass.   served with slice of orange.  more spicy than the bottle version and little of the soapy character typical of a Belgian Wit.   A bit more sweetness also.  Must have been pretty good, as I had 4 pints before moving on...
Bottle- pretty decent. Not my type of beer, bit sweet at the end. Pretty easy to drink
Great beer on tap. In a bottle, not so good. Garnished with an orange. Good with or without. Goes down easy.
I’m not a big fan of white’s and this is very typical of white beers. Kinda sweet and banana flavored, too sweet and fruity for my taste, give me an IPA.
Fruity smelll/taste.  Good with or without an orange slice.  I really enjoyed this beer and will drink it again. Probably tonight!

This is the best beer i have ever tasted. Goes great with an orange.  This was the first beer that made me really like to drink unfiltered wheat beers.  I dont know where i would be without this beer no doubt i would still be drinking bud light like everyone i Know thank you Blue Moon.

This is coors best attempt at beer.  One flaw though....your beer is just a rip off of hoegaarden.   It’s almost as good, but not quite.  I drink this when I’m at a bar and I’m in the mood for white beer(aka when I’m feeling girly and not manly at all)and they don’t have hoegaarden.  Even though I’m knocking it, it really does have a pleasant taste to it.  Exceptionally smooth.  But if you like white beer, pass this up for hoegaarden.

Not bad for an American effort at a Belgian White. Color is pleasingly opaque yellow with a head that’s just a little too disperse. Nose of light coriander and citrus (orange) and quite easy to drink despite the very slight astringency. The flavors are quite interesting, a mellow yeasty breadiness overlayed with a bit of malt and some nice spice and fruit from both esters and orange peel.
I really wasn’t into this beer.  When I think of a wheat beer usually a hefeweizen comes to mind.  This reminded me too much of Hoegarden.  It just was not my style.

I liked the unfiltered feel of this beer, nice color, very white fluffy head that lasted. I don’t usually enjoy wheat beers but i liked this one. Light orange flavor, (had it with and without orange slice). Good beer for a big brewery!
on tap with an orange slice at Tracks Bar & Grill / orange juice with some champagne, then it becomes too acidic. yeah, but it’s actually decent however plain it is.
On tap with and without the orange slice. Spicy with orange notes. Interesting. I will be exploring this category more to be sure.

On tap at local bar : light golden with average but fake head.Aroma and flavor is of citrus, some hops and wheat. Thin to medium-bodied, this is actually not bad, considering it’s made by one of the worst breweries in the world.
I liked this light beer a lot....good taste, even better aftertaste,  Good switch up for us at college, kind of a step up from cheap light beers.

Tap: Hazy cloudy yellow med head gone quickly. Light refreshing citrus aroma. Flavor has almost a dry citrus kick to it with almost no aftertaste. Has always been a safe play when nothing else is available at your local.

Pours a cloudy orange, nice white head. Aroma is bitter orange peel, and the flavor stays pretty dominantly the same, mostly orange peel can’t really taste the coriander when on draught but the spices are more evident in the bottled version. So many people diss this beer and obviously it’s because it’s brewed under coors, personally I can drink the hell out of it all the time, with an orange it’s even better.

On draft at Paninin’s on the OSU campus - skipped the orange wedge.  Cloudy, muddy orange colored beer.  Thin head and no lace.  Refreshing to drink - almost an energy drink - orange citirus notes and a hint of nutmeg?
Nicely done!  Light & refreshing (and even tolerates the "traditional" citrus wedge very well.  Spicy with citrus notes are complemented by a crisp finish and neutral aftertaste.
I tried this beer for the first time today at the advice of a friend.  It was good!  Next time I plan to put an orange in the bottle.

a light yellow color.. lots of carbonation in the pour with a little soapy looking head that disapated very quickly. Aroma was of light hops and citrus... the palate was very light and full of carbonation even though the beer no longer showed this.  I liked the light citris taste all though I felt it too mellow.. Overall I think this was a good beer but nothing amazing
Nice cloudy yellow appearance.  Faint citrus scent and taste.  This is really good and refreshing with an orange slice.

On tap:  Light citrus aroma.  Cloudy orangish yellow with a small white head.  Light citrus lemon and lightly malty flavor.  Rather weak and watered down.  Very little bitterness.  Not much aftertaste.
This is my favorite beer as of now. But I am a sheltered lad. I like the flavor compared to most bitter and cheap beers that I’m familar with.
Tap, bottle. It’s alright, but there are so many other beers that take this one. ’Belgian’ and Coors need no association. A good gateway beer for the ’discerning’ Bud drinker though.
Tap. Interesting appearance, light yellow with lots of cloudy white sediment, light citrus sweet aroma. A bit watery with citrus and spice very tame, but quite drinkable with a very clean finish.
Very fruity aroma and flavor on this witbier, but not enough to make it stand out from others.  Definately not the best in this category.
Nice fruity wit with a nice citrus after taste.  Yeast, citrus aroma. Good with a lemon or orange to excentuate the citrus tastes.  Perfect after a long day of skiing!
Excellent domestic witbier.  Fruity but not overwhelming.  No bitter aftertaste.  One of my favorite easy-to-find beers.
from the tap. poured a cloudy yellow. aroma yeast, citrus, orange and lemon.flavor about the same.smooth could be one of those you could have a few of not to bad
Fragrant floral aromas with a citrus nose.  Orange to amber in color with a thin white head.  Some lacing, thin.  Hoppy flavor with citrus, orange peel notes.  Refreshing and fizzy palate.
Spices are up-front and obvious. Behind the spices is a hint of fruity yeast. The palate is somewhat lacking but overall this is an OK witbier.
not to impressed with the belgian white, not much for taste, kind of a boring hefe with a sweet tang at the end
Blue moon is one of my "easy to get" favorites.  Its very smooth and citrusy.  Although I always do drink it with a lemon slice.

Pretty decent witbier.  The bartender scraped all the head off and filled it all the way.  Hazy orange, tones of spiciness, smooth, very citrusy (caused by lemon in the glass?), and good hop flavor.  I like it.  And it’s from Coors!

Nice citrusy aroma very little to no malt or hops.  Golden yellow with thin white head.  Nice mouthfeel, clean citrusy flavors not much depth.  A bit artificial tasting with a clean short finish.  Overall, nice entry-level wit selection but the color is not really suitable for style.

Hazy, pale orangish color...decent white head.
Nose is most impressive, buzzing with citrus, and spice, almost perfumey, a delightful aroma, just right for a witbier.
Served with lemon, in this case, which I had to manually extrude from the pint glass's brim. Would have gone better with the fish dinner this accompanied.
At the fore, really tasty, full with fruit, big blast of hops, but somehow a touch sour, left me puzzled and dissatisfied. Produced a pucker on the palate, a tightness on the tongue.
Flavor sags some in the middle, too. It acts just like a witbier at the beginning, then quits halfway through, and I'm saddened by the paucity of body and texture...doesn't fail all the way, though, there's still some remnants of that spicey, fruity flavor, but they're too, too faint. Little finish, and once done, I'd forgotten what had happpened. 
Followed this with a pint of Bell's Oberon, which bore none of those failings.
I can only be glad of the popularity of this particular beer, for at least these folks are trying something different. It's a pity, though, that so many think that they're actually drinking a product of Belgium, and I hope they move on to better beers.
Best product that coors has its name on period. Plenty of citrus and subtle tones of spiciness.  Overall a pretty decent entry in the white bier market.

Pours hazy yellow ith a white head. Very buttery malt aroma and taste. Body was creamy but lacked a good spice to the flavor. The flavor of this brew stays with you a while after you drink it, and while this may be appealing for most beers, this was not one of them for me.

Cloudy straw color with very thin white head.  Served with a lemon slice.  Enjoyable fruity aroma with a decent mouthfeel but rather low in flavor.  Not bad just a little watered down tasting.  My wife liked it, so I’m sure i’ll give it a second chance.

This beer is so incredibly overrated.  I have it on several occasions, and it has never impressed.  It does have promising superficial characteristics (aroma and apperance), but the flavor and after-taste are negative.  Not favorable on the palate.  For a belgian, it lacks any identify (except for being a crappy beer in my mind).

This is a white?  Looks more like an American unfiltered wheat, and flavor is the same - malty, low hops, very little complexity.  Does have a nice creamy mouthfeel, but I expect a witbeer to have more of a spicy and yeasty zing to it.

Not a bad brew, but it has a weird aftertaste that takes a while to clear out of your mouth.  This is making inroads in the Chicago area in bottles and on tap.  I s’pose it’s an interesting change for folk.  Light yellow with good body, it carries a fruity aroma with a hint of grasses - not uncommon in a wheat.  Spicy finish.  Not a bad attempt by Coors.
I really liked this for an every day casual beer. Went well with lunch, and went well with the Austen I was reading.

Light yellow beer whose head doesn’t stand up too well for a witbier.  Some soapy aromas, cereal, and peach.  Thin mouthfeel with a chalky finish.  Exceeded my expectations for a mass market beer, but not by a whole lot.
Orange in color with a white head. Smells like fruit loops. Taste is watery and fruity. Not much complexity. Tastes similar to a Sam Adams White ale w/o the hops. Very bland in taste.

This ia really a very good beer.  The aroma of apricots and spice doesn’t overpower the wheat and hops.  It was served with a slice of arange and having sampled it both ways, I say keep the orange, for aroma matters.
Good mass market stuff, but pretty wipy when compared to some of the wheat smaller batches.  Again, a good choice at the local grocery store.

Poured cloudy golden yellow with a thin white head with big bubbles...seemed too yellow...smells a little lemony and also like gummy worms...tastes very bland...very lightly spiced (if at all) with cloves and coriander...thin bodied, but the cleanest sweetest finish I have yet to find in a White...as bland as it is, it is still somehow flavorful (I know that goes against what I said previously) and refreshing...good late night summer sitting on the patio beer...

I had this on tap at the Reno airport of all places.  The bartender said it was a heffewiezen but i didn’t see any in the list so i’m guessing it was this.  Anyways, this was a decent beer especially compared to the other crap they had on tap.  Decent taste but nothing special

Maybe it was because we just came off the golf course and needed an elixir, but I found this to be surprisingly pretty good.  Cloudy pale yellow, citrus and fruit on the nose, some light wheat taste, good mouthfeel and quite refreshing.
large head yellow wheat body. nice aroma. wheat tastes smooth very nice wheat beer.  very good wheat beer even if it is owned by coors.

on tap at some Vegas casino bar,well first off the guy served it to me in a plastic cup with a peice of orange in it WTF? anyway from what i could tell it was bitter and cittriusy,and had an orange color, wonder why?

This was probably my first venture into the whole "belgian" beer scene.  Yeah  its Coors and its not the greatest belgian white but it was good then, and its still not bad today.  But like my friend tsarman said in his review, I’d rather go with the Hoegaarden

Tasteed in Colorado (Vail).  Tasted in pint glass.  Unfortunately, it was served with a lemon in it, so the taste might be slightly biased.   Neon yellow colour, thin white head, cloudy.  Aroma of citrus and lemon.  (Did I mention the slight bias?). Taste of wheat and lemon. Refreshing, but has very little spicyness and complexity found in this style of beer.

Overall I really enjoyed this beer.  There was a pleasant hint of citrus in the aroma.  Smooth, clean taste.  Did not try it with an orange slice, but it had vague hints of citrus in the taste already.  Overall, an actual quality product from Coors.

12oz.  Cloudy, lemon-colored, small white head, no lace, particulates.  Citrus-clove aroma with a touch of musk, light aroma.  Mouth is medium with lots of foamy carbonation, fairly dry beer.  Flavor contains coriander, orange, lemon, wheat, a touch of clove, a weak hop profile.  Sessionable.  



Bottled.  Blonde beer, white head, didn’t last well, didn’t lace well.  Malty aroma, some wheat and yeast.  Flavor is blande sweetness with something else I don’t care for.  I didn’t finish this beer.  Lots of carbonation.
Who would have thought that Coors could produce such an excellent beer.  While it goes best with an orange slice and I usually do not like Belgian White... this beer just caught my attention.

Had this on tap so I’m sure it’s better than bottled. Hazy straw color. Ok head,full citrusy/orange and coriander nose. Start was pretty citrusy with coriander and mild peaches,very smooth tho the finish was a bit dull. Great summer beer.
Pours yellow/gold.  It smells like faint berries, it had a blueberry floral taste to me.  I don’t exactly like this flavor, but it wasn’t too bad.

Pale straw colored, appropriately cloudy, dazzling white cap of foam. Leaves no lacing; the foam slumps down the sides of the glass to beer level. Mild aromas of sulfury phenol, fresh hay, citrus zest, violets and sweet/sharp coriander. Mild flavor as well, tastes like Grape Nuts cereal with whispers of PineSol, potpourri, and baby aspirin. Interesting palate: light, crisp, and effervescent, slightly tart and oily at the same time. Clean finish, vague aftertaste of peaches, ginger, and flowers. Ok wit, if a little dull.
Fresh taste, hints of orange and pollen. Decent beer for its style, but falls short of remarkable.
Nice orangey taste. Very smooth and a new summer favorite along with Bell’s Oberon.
1st white beer I can remember having.  The mildlyunderstated wheat allowed the fruitiness to come thru quite nicely.  I enjoyed this beer.
I really enjoyed this.  It wowed me and was unlike anything I’ve had before (have not tried any Belgians).  Floral and berry aroma with strawberry-type taste in the body.  Nice wheat taste too.

a extremely well made beer for a macro owned brewery. The wheat and fruity aroma is mild, and it adds to the overall flavor, which is mostly fruit, citrus. The feel of the beer in the mouth is silk wheat, very smooth but just has the wheat bread feel.
great tasting beer. i love the bottle too. fruity taste, and found in most local stores. definetly had this beer more than a few times.

Bottle.  Nice white head on a hazy yellow body.  Nice fruity aroma.  Taste is a mix of fuirt and spice with a hint of citrus.  Rather complex and interesting.  Also, noted sediment on the bottom of the bottle indicating that it was not filtered......nice

On tap. Poured a hazy yellow with a small head. It was brought to me with an orange peel in the glass (why do they do that!). Smells and tastes of, guess what, oranges with some wheat. Did not impress me. Should I try it again without the orange peel - not sure it is worth it...
I haven’t had this in a while, but I remember it as a mediocre white.  Nothing great, but nothing too aweful.

My favorite beer of them all, i tried this in Boston after a red sox game and did it hit the spot! up there, they slip an orange slice into the neck so the beer passes through during each pull from the bottle, tastes good that way but Blue Moon should just be drank ice cold from a glass, Bottoms Up!

Blue Moon, you saw me standing alone, so I picked up the bottle, I needed one of my own.  Pretty flavorful, but it doesn’t feel or look like a Witbier to me.  It belongs in another category, but its an overall good beer from the Coors people. My friends JB and CG swear by it, but I’d pick up a Hoeer any time.
A decent, but not great beer. Very bitter taste. It’s very much the traditional Belgian White Ale, so if you like the flavor of them, this might not be a terrible choice.

Blue Moon pours a hazy, yellow color with big bubbles, a thin head, and a decently sweet aroma.  It is spicy, a bit acidic (less so than similar brews), smooth, a bit peppery, and a bit lemony, with a slightly dry finish.

[draft - Dave & Buster’s - Homestead, PA] Poured an orange color with a thin white head. Looked more like a hefeweizen than a witbier in my opinion. Faint aroma of wheat and citrus. Slightly watered down taste, mainly wheat and yeast with a slightly sweet citrus finish. Not too bad. Went well with the orange that came with it.

The first time I tried this I was not too impressed, grainy and acidic with very little spice. At the Coors brewery it seemed to benefit from its freshness, still grainy, still atouch acidic but the orange is instantly noticeable while the coriander while somewhat subdued compared to the Hoe palys a nice role. Not spectacular but a decent drink it if you find it beer.

Hazy dark yellow beer with a fine fast disappearing head. Weak aroma, tones of wheat and coriander. Also coriander in the flavor along with wheat, yeast and some citrusy. Quite thin and really not very interesting.

very spicy wheat brew.   not bad for being as widespread common as it is.  possible nice portal to bigger and better things.  i liked it before i understood what a great belgium beer meant, and still enjoy one once in a while, but not quite as good as i once thought.   will use this beer to give to my buddies when they come over and i dont want to break into my cellar and have my good brew taken for granted, but still want to show them something a little different than mgd.
a good beer that is widely available on tap used to like it a lot when i didnt really like beer because it is not very bitter at all.  cloudy.  some spice and fruity flavors.

Beer pours appropriately cloudy, though a rather darker golden that is usual for the style.  Head is white and dissipates fairly rapidly.  Aroma is wheaty with some light yeastiness and an off aroma that can best be described as wet cardboard.  Flavor improves upon the aroma with lemon flavor and some light wheat flavor.  Average, but with so many good examples of the style easily available, I will probably never drink this one again.

surprisingly decent. plenty of coriander in the aroma, light lemon meringue taste, a bit thin for the style but better than most american wits i tasted and much better than i expected anything on the coors brewery tour would be

Continuing on Belgianight, Allagash is going to be pretty hard to top. Very much like the description depicts. Mellow is a good word nothing is over done.  Could be very easily mistaken for a German Hefeweizen without the hops. Looks like one, very nice brew. I’m surprised and pleased this one was better than average.

Ok first time I have seen this brew up here in Salem, Oregon so here goes.
Bought in the 12 oz brown long neck.
Its a nice enough beer to look at hazy straw gold..but the head is pretty small and goes fast..some splotchy lace left on glass sides.
for a "wit" the aroma is average at best..theres none of the expected spiciness here..just nice malts ..and a faint banana pudding odor.
Again the taste is inoffensive but not very exciting.its mainly malts..though I dodetect some VERY faint coriander.
Pretty average on the palte..nothing out of the ordinary.
For all kits faults its still quite quaffable..but if you want an American interpretation of a wheat..try New Belgiums Sunshine Wheat Beer
ugh.  orange color, white head.  this is not good, jesus chirst 3.05?  give me a break.  i had to choke one down to actually drink it.  all i hear is people raving about this beer...bleh

Pours a cloudy orangish color. Aroma of peach/orange which pleasing. fruity at first which settles into more wheat which then settles into a nice fruity after taste. After a while it begans to dull though. Overall not bad, good for summer.
This is what Bud would taste like if they pitched a belgian yeast strain instead of whatever crap they normally use. Belgian taste is there, but the corn and sour taste really comes through. Yuck.
nice beer felt like the carbonation was overpowering. light enough to enjoy multiple.

This is not bad for a comercial giant mainstream  brewery. I actually think it gets like a Belgian witbier. Then after that you can decide wether or nor you like that style, but i’m sorry to say that  this beer does it.
Cloudy orange appearance with a thin white head. Aroma is very orange/peachy. The flavor is way overpowering in peach flavor. It also tastes soapy to me. Maybe they can market Blue Moon soaps?

Very enjoyable brew.  Very fruity and citrusy, but not too overpowering.  Light infusion of coriander and a touch of sour honey in there as well.  I had this not knowing who made it, and I stand by my rating.  I’ve since had it again, and I still enjoy it.  So there.

a yellow wit biere ?
nice head white short lasting
aroma of coriander no orange maybe ginger not sure. spicy no hop finish wich is correct.
had six for dinner on a sailboat, so no color or nose to report, sorry.  sweet flavor, slight chickenfeed.  absent of wheat bite, was there some other malt in there? unimpressive.
Tried at Waitor’s Recommendation.  He should be shot.  Easy enough to drink if you like Budweiser.

I get this beer pretty often on tap topped with an orange or lemon wedge. Murky looking brew with rather nice aroma and enjoyable on the palate. Sort of light but smooth and really drinkable. I actually like this a lot.

Pours a cloudy light orange with very little head. A real light wheat aroma, maybe some fruit like peach or orange in there. Mellow taste with hints of orange, lemon and spice. Nothing overly great, but still easy and enjoyable to drink.

This wheat beer pours out with a golden yellow/orange color.  The beer is unfiltered and therefore has a nice cloudy appearance.  The aroma is nothing distinct.  The taste is mild and again not distinct.  Not bitter nor sweet.  A pinch of lemon and spices.  Aftertaste is light and easy to forget.  Not worth the 7 bucks I paid for it.
on tap. cloudy yellow with white head. very lemony, both in aroma and taste. very light flavor and mouth feel.
oh wow this is not the best. cloudy yellow color.  Taste is really not that good and has a bite after taste.

Pour this one into a dark glass, because you do not want to look through it. At first impression it was a little scary, kind of looking like unchanged fish bowl water. However the taste was not appalling, it just was not good. After a night of these bring some toilet paper to the throne, cause your gonna need it.
Pours cloudy yelowish/orange. Citrusy nose with a crisp taste with decent after bite. Not as strong as other belgian whites I’ve had but this is a very decent beer. Very drinkable.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy, hazy pee yellow.  Aroma of SPF 40 sun screen (what the hell), sweet, and over ripened banana.  Tasted like drinking sun screen also. Not my cup of tea!  Some how I did get the whole bottle down.
I enjoyed the hints of spices, but otherwise it’s not special, though decent.

Bottle, draught.  This one has gone down in quality over the last 2 years.  It used to be a nice solid witbeer, but now it tastes a little like raw hot dog water.  Nose is the same.  Nice cloudy amber color with good head and carbonation, but it is losing my purchases as it seems to get worse with each passing month.  I’ll try again soon just to be sure.
