Great flavor true to style. Smooth after taste..............................

Not too into the Belgian brews, but I do like this drink.  I liked the way I had to swish the goodness out of the mostly empty bottle.  I did not like the fruity taste.  It seemed to remind me of a "orange hooch". I will rate this as "ok".
Yuck! One of the worst Belgian Whites I've tasted...........................

two disclaimers: i'm not familiar with belgian whites (they're too expensive) and i'm very wary of spiced beers.  by the  packaging i had suspected that this was from a faux-micro, but just learned today that it's a coors product.  certainly they're capable of producing good beers, but who cares?  mcdonald's could probably make a great souffle´ but they choose to pander rubbish, so i don't appreciate the false front. a twist-off cap: subtract another asthetic point. but what's this: it's  actually very nice in color, just like bee hive honey.  the aroma is florid: perfumy and sweet like the wine you guzzle in high school and barf. continuing on our roller coaster of impressions, the taste is not bad. well, not tooooo bad.  try to think of days so hot you're just about brain dead anyway and all you can do is pant like a st. bernard.  then this beer would probably hit the spot--if someone else buys it, and you're trying to be agreeable.  there's no discernable wheat here, like in a spaten club-weisse.  there's a sweetness that's not offensive, but just a little finish of that cheap-graininess that i associate with american beers, maybe it's rice. my bottle is almost dead-flat though it boasts a freshness date deadline of may 26, 12,904.  (how can a beer last over 10,000 years?!?)  anyway, call it boone's farm belgian.  i think i'll save my money for the real stuff.
very good beer, but somewhat inferior to Sunshine Wheat.....................

Screw this shit. 

Your not a Belgian. You'll never be a Belgian, Blue Moon. You won't fool me, Coors.
initially was very impressed with peach color and smooth flavor which goes down very fast but it i got old after a couple

Interesting. Pineapple juice colored, cool label. Aroma and flavor dominated by pineapple and coriander. A change of pace, worthy of trial and discussion. Wouldn't want to over-indulge in this one! I think I'll try it as a pork marinade.
Very light and smooth with plenty of flavor. Good dinner beer if you're a beer snob and she's not.
Nice, but not Hoegaarden. It would be good with Indian food.................
Not as complex or interesting as belgian beer from belgium, but tasty all the same.
Not bad; won't go out of my way to find it again............................
I don't particularly like it, but I think it gets people who like it to try real belgians.  Better than crap lager, though.

i like this beer! of course, it was really my first foray into the belgian style and was basically all a body could get in FL for the longest time in that genre....but since then, i've tried a few other belgian style white beers (not as many as most people here obviously) but i really enjoy the taste of this beer. not as much as blanche de chambly but more than hoegaarden.
Wasn't bad, wasn't good.  Very bland version of a white.....................
I tried this a while back and I really liked it. ...........................
Bland, if you're looking for a belgium-style white, drink a microbrews white.
It calls itself a "Belgian White", even though it doesn't taste like any other Witbiers I've had.  Its spiciness is quite unusual and unbalanced.  Drinkable, but not too good.
It was ok, it smelled real bad but tasted fine, it got me pretty well drunk too.

Good, but not in the league of Hoegaarden or Blanche de Chambly. Not as overwhelmingly spicy or tart, but very refreshing nonetheless. Not as cloudy as other wits either. Pleasant enough to have another one;.
Much better than Coors. Tastes a little like fresh flowers..................

This takes nothing like Hoegaarden, aweful, tasted like ten-year-old V8
...

This is a very good beer, in spite of being a Coors contract brew.  Mellow and delicately spiced.  Only slightly sweet without any yeasty overtones.  Hints of citrus and floral flavors, but not fruity.  Probably not in keeping with a true Belgian white style, but a good beer nonetheless.

I dislike Belgian White Ales traditionally.    The harsh peppery characater is too unsettling for my pallette.   With that in mind I give my opnion that Blue Moon sits well with me.    Probably because it's flavor is a little west of a true Belgium.   It greets with a nice spicy nose and produces a nice smooth drink with just hints of orange and pepper taste.   It's more subtle and not overpowering.    So as a 'belgium white' I doubt it bodes well; but, as  a good drink I love it.
Very, very tasty.  WHile I have no other experience with belgian whites, I quite enjoy the spiciness of this beer and the zippy finish.
A tad weak for a Belgian wheat ale, but Blue Moon makes up for the lack of strength with a smooth texture.
Not what I expected.  It was ok but not something I loved...................
My second favorite beer of all time, also apparently unavailable in western Canada. Detractors of this brew should stick to MGD! To me, it's better than the true Belgian whites in every way.
The first belgian white beer i have ever had and i was impressed. It was light and crisp and very refreshing.

I view white beers something like I view jazz; there's something I just don't get, although I usually admire the craftsmanship.  This beer, however, must be the Kenny G of beers.  The ornamentation of extras strains, in a desperate, sickly way, to cover up for a lack of real substance.
Awesome white beer.  Light.  Citrus.  Unfiltered.  I have turned many people onto this.  I even had it on tap in Atlantic City NJ!
If you want a good witbier buy Hoegaarden!..................................

one of the better American micro interpretations of a Belgian wit.  
very light and tart. a refreshing beverage
This was a very boring beer. It didn't taste bad, but there was nothing special about it. Though I tend to not like Belgian whites anyways.

I first had this ale at the Coors brewery in Golden Colorado,It has a sweet but fruity taste very refreshing.
The hostess at the Coors brewery said it is usually served very cold and with a slice of lemon to bolster the already fruity taste.
Slightly above average, but better than most American Wits I've had. The fact that this comes from Coors is mysteriously obscured on the label. Refreshing, especially from the folks in Golden, CO.
Too fruity and sweet. This stuff tastes unnatural. Of course it is made by Coors, so what can be expected.

Oh, how I miss Celis. This one runs riskily close to alchopop. The overwhelming fruitiness tasts unatatural and seems to be there to hide its lack of depth. I will drink it asgain as my local just replaced Sam Adams with Bud Light, this is now the only drinkable beer in the place.
Decent white but the mega-giants turn it into a soft drink. Just too much of everything. Not bad, but not good.
A good job by a macro brewer for once.  Refreshing and decent taste for the style.
Nice copper color, unfiltered, and slight head. Very sweet smell, much like apricots or oranges. Fruity and spicy, although the citrus flavor is almost overpowering.

This was by no means bad, just weak relative to Hoegaarden.  Had a strong citric taste, with  cloudy, slightly brown-yellow coloring. Little head corresponded with the flavor, which just seemed a little off.  Less tangy and spicy than Hoegaarden.
Very nicely spiced, though a bit on the thin side. .........................

Heard this was a good brew, but when it came w/ a lemon, I knew this was going to be trouble.  I didn't like the flavor at all, but I'll give it the benefit of the doubt for when I try it w/out the fruit.
Refreshing and drinkable. Nice example of a great style.....................
Hey, not bad!  Not too complex or anything, but nice and refreshing and quenching.
Weird looking and weird tasting beer.  Not something I would want to have more than one enough.
Pungent aroma, very spicy flavor.  I can say that the appearance is very nice - an opaque orange/yellow.  I wouldn't want a steady diet of them though.
Good beer if you don't want to drink more than one. After one you realize how terrible it tastes.

Nice aroma and spice flavors.  Goes well
with a slice of orange.  A bit weaker than 
other Belgiums, but refreshing nonetheless.
I loved it, but it pales in comparison to Celis.............................
But I don't really like Belgian Wheats......................................
I'm not a big fan of Belgian style wheat ales, but I do like Blue Moon. I always drink mine with a slice of lemon, kinda like a Corona with lime. A refreshing beer that isn't too hoppy or malty.
